1.content:
You wake to find yourself in a small diner. Nothing around you looks familiar, and you are completely alone. Or are you? You hear strange, shuffling sounds outside. You peer out through the large windows, but all you can see is dense fog, and occasional shapes moving out there, slowly, in the darkness.

Looking around you, you see a telephone. You pick it up and find that there is no dial tone, only static. It sounds almost like whispering. Creeped out, you hang the phone up.

You search around the diner, hoping to find some clues to where you might be. The last thing you remember is seeing a child in the road, veering off into the ditch. Now, you're awake, with a terrible headache, with no idea how you got to this strange, empty little diner.

There is a newspaper on a nearby table.
1.title: Strange Awakening

Then you relax. You find that the 'creature' is only a child. A small, thin child of about seven.

Just then you hear a voice outside the diner calling out - "Hey! Anyone in there?"

1111.content:
You duck behind the counter, hoping to avoid whoever called out.

The child stares at you with frightened eyes, terrified you'll reveal her position. You try to convey without speaking that you won't give her away.

The man who called out from outside the diner opens the door and steps inside.

"Who's in here?"

You frown: there's something strange about his voice. It sounds as if there's more than one person speaking at a time.

Suddenly something cold and heavy slips around your wrist. Jumping in surprise, nearly crying out, you look down to see that the waif-like little girl has encircled your wrist with her hand. The poor thing is terrified.

The man with the disturbing voice speaks again.

"I can feel you! Come out! Give me the girl and I'll let you go!"

The girl, obviously worried you'll consider his offer, whispers to you, "Don't let go."

With whom shall you side?
1111.title: Don't let go.

11111.content:
I feel the child's pulse beating as she clings to me desperately. Her tension and fear transmit to me. I feel chill slip through my very bones - my mind racing in a frantic search for a way out.

The presence of the stranger hangs about the air and it makes breathing hard and shallow. Carefully, as if fearing that turning of a head will bring about enough noise to give us away, I look around.

The behind-the-counter world of dust and cobwebs gapes at us indifferently. I notice our hunched shadows reflecting in the misty beer bottles that occupy lower shelves - they are dangerous witnesses. But then I notice a small opening, presumably door, leading somewhere unknown.

With the down-force of my leap, I landed the sharp, splintered wooden stake into soft fleshy area where his shoulder me his neck, behind his collar bone. His big tough body seized in pain and he let out a devil-like growl. I hung like hell to his back, my arm around his neck. I used my free hand and hooked his eye from behind, I dug the nail of my middle finger into his left eye and ripped back. He stumbled back and out into the hall just outside the door. I had no control over the rage; the next thing I saw was me ripping out a large chunk of his shoulder with my teeth. Just then, Momma Dearest appeared from out of nowhere and into the corner of my peripheral vision. Running at us, axe in hand, the tip raised just above her shoulder line. With a wild and nasty spin she swung the axe horizontally. The rage pumped blood soo hard through me it must have increased my cognitive function two-fold because in that instant she seemed to be moving at half speed and I watched her dirty, bloody hands grip tighter around the handle and the axe fly at me in slow motion. I jumped off and to the side just in time but not fast enough. The axe put a nasty gash in my hip before getting lodged into Masons lower spine.

I felt nothing. No pain, no fear. Mason had taken so much damage he couldn't do anything but let out a deep growl of agonizing pain. I howled at the top of my lungs with insanity "Ha haa! How does it feel to get F*CKED MASON?!". I turned and sprinted for the door at the end of the hall. As I took my first step toward freedom, The walls and my vision in front of me twisted and skewed like the rims of a screw. Callie was at the door. Momma Dearest let out a piercing howling scream that started chipping, shattering, breaking the hall walls behind me. I continued to run straight ahead ignoring Callie's dizzying illusion and Momma's crippling scream. I was steps away from the door and that clingy demon girl. If she grabbed me and weighted me down I'd instantly lose. The rage rushed the brute force solution to my brain and the answer came in the form an outraged battle cry, "F*ck that! Soccer kick that little bitch!" I screamed in my head, Masons flesh still clenched between my teeth. I winded up running full speed and kicked her head, sending it smashing to the wall on the right. The wood had no chance of withstanding the force of her face at those speeds and half her head was lodged into the wall. The twisted illusion quickly faded with Callie's consciousness. I knew she wasn't dead but the destructive force of Momma Dearest's scream was a second behind me. The same second I used to kick open the door and sprint up the stairs. As I reached the top I found myself right back where I first started. This hellish diner.

The cloud of smoke outside was heavy and so was the ash-fall. The rage suddenly left me and I was spitting Mason's flesh and blood out on the street I walked down. Goddamn -Baker st-. As I held my gash and limped quickly down the street toward the church in the distance I noticed the ringing in my ears was gone and I was almost completely exhausted. Out running spitters in my current condition, possible, at least for awhile. Out running them in pitch blackness, impossible. Thoughts rushed frantically through my mind trying to find a solution, trying to stay alive. 'Rrrrrraaaaaaaooooooooo' an unbelievably loud disaster alarm starting wailing so loud I couldn't think. Frozen in place, I suddenly became aware of a malevolent pressure that seemed to consume me entire body. Briefly glancing over my shoulder, I saw nothing following which should have made me feel better. Instead, it had the opposite effect. Every tree limb seemed to reach for me every stump seemed to try to pull me down into the frozen earth. Stumbling over such a stump I would almost swear I felt hands grasp my ankles. I leapt up with a renewed sense of vigor. Widening my strides I was sure death awaited around every bush, tree, and hillside.
Although I had been running for only minutes, I felt as though I had run halfway around the world. Pausing out of necessity to catch what little breath I could, I noticed a clearing not far from where I had kneeled. My thoughts were racing in every direction, but one thing I knew, I had to reach that clearing and I had to reach t now! My whole body shook as I made my final dash. I ran so hard my feet kicked the snow into the air so high off the ground I was finding it increasingly difficult to see. It was as if Mother Nature herself was trying to prevent my escape.
Finally, I was only feet from safety. I stepped into the clearing bent over and began to breath heavily as is I had manage to steal my own life back from what ever was hell bent on keeping it. After a few silent moments I became to calm down. Slowly but surely my wits returned. I began to feel as foolish as a schoolchild who had wet their pants. Just when I had began to convince myself that it was all just my imagination I looked up and saw what appeared to be a door leading straight into the ground. Possibly a cellar door but the dim light that penetrated the holes and cracks gave an almost ominous glow. 1111112121.content:
Like a broken record, the girl keeps repeating herself. "Please no, please no, please no..." You're doing the right thing, you think. The dumbest thing imaginable, but still the right thing.

You step forward, putting yourself between the girl and the massed crowd, raise your middle finger and yell, "Fuck you!" It comes out a little closer to a whimper than you mean for it to, but hey. You tried to sound brave. Those are some good last words.

The man at the front of the crowd laughs, spits on the ground, then says, "Buddy, I'm not sure that you understand the nature of the situation right now. We're not the bad guys here. I can see how you feel, but we're trying to help you and maybe get you out of this place before nightfall. Trust me, you don't want to be here after then. Now, you can't get out on your own, but if you give her to us, we might be able to help you. So, what's it gonna be?"

"What do you want her for?" you ask.

The leader pauses for a moment, and two of those behind him step forward. He holds up his hand to stop them. "You don't know what that is, do you?"

You stare and feel your mouth drop open slightly. The man smiles and says, "Oh my God, you honestly think that's a little girl, don't you?" he bursts out laughing, then continues, "That ain't a little girl. Maybe it used to be, but it hasn't been for a long damn time. If you knew what you're standing in front of right now, you'd probably shit yourself."

With a glance over your shoulder, you confirm that there is still a small girl in a pink dress standing at the end of the alley, muttering "please no," and letting tears stream down her dirty face. "Uh, yeah," you say, "Are you fucking crazy?"

The two men step forward again. One of them takes a metal pipe from a loop in his belt. "You're going to have to trust us," their leader says, then adds, "It looks like a girl, but it's not. That's how it tricks people. That fucker got Jim last week. He chased it into a warehouse right before nightfall, and when we came in after it was all over to rescue him, we couldn't find enough of him to stuff in a basket for the burial."

You hesitate, and the leader says, "Your call. But we're killing that little shit."

Just then, as the man with the lead pipe steps less than a foot away, a siren begins to wail. Its hollow call echos through the streets and alleys of the town like a forsaken animal. "Oh, shit," the man with the pipe yells, dropping his weapon, "shit, shit, fuck!"

The entire crowd backs away, then turns around and begins to run worldessly into the fog. The group's leader falls to the ground after they get out into the street, then yells something inaudible. The sky begins to darkness, and then suddenly drops into shadow. Darker shapes move in the street, just on the edge of your vision, and the man screams again, more like an animal being torn apart than a human being. You look behind you, and the girl is still there, her eyes wide with terror.

1111112221.title: Grab the girl and hide

1111112222.content: The child screams as you grab her arm and push her down the hole. You look at your pursuers a split second before following her. You hear a loud splash and then the muffled gurgle of water as you frantically swim to the surface. Looking around for the girl, you notice that she is motioning to you across the way. She shivers and connects herself to your arm, pleading for you to tell her what to do next. You check your surroundings and find that hardly anything is visible besides the water and the hole you came from. You notice that the water is a stream and flows towards your left.
1111112222.title: go down the hole

choices: Turn the flashlight on and look.
11111122221.content: You follow the current to what seems to be a sewer system of sorts. As you look around, you notice that there is a flashlight. When you grab it, a feeling of déjà vu comes over you. At that time you relize the girl is missing. You then notice a sound to you right. It sound like an animal sort.
11111122221.title: Travel with the current.

choices: You regain composure and continue looking for ways to get out.
You become angry at the creature, find a weapon and pursue it.
111112.content:
You decide to wait behind the counter to see if the person inside the diner will leave. The little girl squeezes you wrist even tighter as the man approaches the counter. He says slowly and with a type of hiss "pathetic."

He reaches across the counter and grabs the edge. You notice his fingers have a sickly color to them. He promptly rips the counter from it's foundation and tosses it with ease across the diner. This thing is not human.

Your hiding spot has now been revealed and you look up terrified into your pursuers eyes. To your horror his eyes are not in their sockets, instead they hang from his neck hooked to a necklace. His mouth is wide, almost like a frogs would be and from beneath his thin lips you see the tips of what look like very sharp teeth.

"Hello child... Who's your friend?" he hisses as he kneels down coming face to face with the small girl. The eyes on his necklace are focused on you. The girl is staring wide eyed into it's empty eyes sockets. She is petrified.

The creature lets out a hiss as it's mouth slowly opens revealing dozens more of those sharp pointy and now noticibly long teeth. It's mouth opens to the size of a large beachball. A low growl bellows from it's throat and it's tongue spills out and slowly creeps to lap the girls face. "yesss." it hisses. Its tongue then wraps around the girls head and reels it into it's mouth. You close your eyes for lack of being able to do anything else. You hear a sickly crunch and the girls death grip on your wrist fails. You open your eyes, to see the thing slowly lurching back through the door of the diner it calls back "your next." and then it disappears into the fog.

You look down to the headless bloody mess that was the girl and you fall to the ground, scramble into a corner and cry.
111112.title: Stay hidden behind the counter

choices: Follow the beast's lead and go out through the front door into the dense fog...
Slide a table and stack a chair onto it, and gain acess to the roof...
1111121.content:
You cry for seconds - or hours, as time seems to slow down before you can pull yourself back together. Pulling your knees to your chest and lacing your fingers behind your neck, you start rocking. Through gritted teeth, and the slow rhythmic beat of your head on the discolored drywall behind you, you manage to force your breathing to a normal rate.

Finally, you find the strength to stand. The smell of your charges blood is rank in your nostrils and with a physical effort, you manage to stop the heaving in your gut. Looking around the room with the conscience effort to avoid the mess left by the beast, you see that there aren't many choices of where to go. The wreckage of the counter is blocking access to the small door you had seen when you where hiding with the girl.

Above where the counter once was is a small, rusted roof access hatch. You can see gray light streaming in where rubber seals have corroded. It seems that only the small interior bolt holds it closed. It's well over 10 feet to the hatch, and the only way to get up there is to drag a table over and get a chair to stand on...
1111121.title: You regain composure and continue looking for w...

choices: Follow the blood trail to the right, and see where the monster went.
Climb around the wreckage on the right and try to track down the monster's lair.
11111211.content:
Standing amidst the carnage, you find yourself unable to make a decision. Eventually, spurred by the stench of the child that was once under your protection, your indecision turns to anger. You begin to shake with rage at the injustice you’ve witnessed. A child, an innocent child, was literally mauled to death in front of you. And you sat and did nothing…

Assembling a tower to climb to the roof hatch isn’t an option. Turning towards the door, you look around for anything to use as a weapon. Finding the broken leg of a table, you heft it, testing its weight, and find it acceptable. Clenching your club, you walk through the shattered doorway and into the mist outside.

The mist is thick, rank with the sour scent of death, and makes seeing more than a few feet in front of you impossible. The humidity soaks in almost immediately, the chill that creeps into your bones needs no supernatural guide – weather like this would do it naturally, if you could call weather like this natural.

Looking around you can see only the feint outline of cars parked in front of the diner. The car to the left looks misshaped, and you assume the monster came from that direction. A quick glance down shows a trail of blood leading into the mist on the right; apparently the monster had not gone the direction it came…

Not thirty feet from your last crossroad, you find yourself at another. Which way do you go?
11111211.title: Follow the beast's lead and go out through ...

choices: Go Back Down Into the Diner, Where the Breathing is Coming From
Climb Down the Side of the Diner
11111212.content:
You reach trembling hands to the table, pushing it under the hatch even as your tears spill. You don't understand what's happening, but you wrist still burns with the impression of the girl's grip. You let her die!

It takes several minutes to stack the chair on the table and pry open the hatch. You grip a weathered edge, ignoring the splinters of wood pushing into your skin, and pull yourself up. The roof is bare and empty. You walk to the edge, eyes watering. Nothing can be seen but the thick fog. It is then you realize that the tears pushing your eyes may not just be sadness. There is a persistent stinging, your throat feels scratchy and you think you hear song.

No, not song. What is it? It's like a memory of song, a memory of safety and rhyme and reason and everything coming together. If you could only find it...

"Shit!" Your heart beats faster as you realize you are only a step from the edge. You had been about to take that step.

There is no trace of song now. Only the fog, and your heartbeat in your ears.

You have to get inside. You can't stay out here, if you wait, someone will come, someone -

"Hello and welcome to Silent Hill!" You jerk. It is the voice of the man from before, the eyeless man, seeming to come from all around and filled with dark humor.

"If you show fear, we will use it to track you. If you fight, you will lose. If you hide, we will find you. You will find no help here. Find your own way out, or we will make it for you. You will not enjoy that. The game starts for you now, dreamer. Good luck!" The deep voice faded with a last laugh.

As you spin around, trying to locate it's source, you notice something. It is small, but it freezes you in terror. Beneath you, something is breathing.
11111212.title: It Begins For You, Dreamer

choices: Go back out to try to fight again.
Find a way around the monster.
1111122.content:
As you cry you think of the evil thing that took the small childs life and you become enraged! You stand up with new purpose and begin searching for a weapon with which you can kill the monster. You look and almost immediately you see a large metal rod that had fallen from the bottom of the counter when the thing had ripped it up.

You pick it up and it feels good in your hands. It feels like it's your purpose to hunt this thing down. One end of the pipe is splayed and jagged, perfect for tearing skin from bone. You lift the object like a baseball bat and step out side of the diner.

The fog engulfs you and you are hard pressed to see much of anything. Something whispers and it sounds as if the whisper circled around you several times. As you distance yourself from the diner the whispers get louder, more low grumbles. A constant white noise begins to fill your ears, and you realize the pipe is becoming ever more encumbering. You let it fall to your side and drag it making a grating sound on the pavement. The fog thickens evermore and the noises get louder. You begin to understand what they are saying. "Get away!" "Stay back!" "I'll kill you if you take another step!" You keep trudging on ignoring the warnings.

The pipe becomes so heavy it is immovable, you let it go. You can't see five feet infront of you and the voices and white noise is getting louder. You drop to your knees and cover your ears. The noise persist to an almost deafening state. Then all at once it stops.

You lift your head and listen for anything. not a sound is audible. Then you see something round rolling towards you it rolls briskly and ends up between your knees face up. It is the girls head! It's eyes stare up frightend and cold. You push it away and cower away from it. "Pathetic!" Hisses the creature. Then you are lifted up by seemingly nothing and thrown at least twenty feet through the air landing on your back. The fog begins to thin and waft away and you realize to your utter dismay that you are back in the diner.
1111122.title: You become angry at the creature, find a weapon...

choices: Stay behind the counter and fight the creature with your gun.
Flee through the passageway that you discovered earlier behind the counter.
11111221.content: You decide to go back out and fight again, but before you go back out, you search behind the counter of the diner again and find a .45 semi-automatic pistol with 10 rounds in it. You disengage the safety and make your way more slowly to the door. You open, you immediately see the dark shape of the creature, you are sure it is the same creature, its dark emanations of evil are very palpable, but it looks different, it is now a monstrous, ugly, gray thing, with scruffy patches of hair, piebald skin. At the moment, due to the mist, you can see no more. You stay close to the diner, remembering the creatures power when you ventured into the night previously. You quickly take aim and squeeze off all ten rounds, and you can tell by the shriek in the night that at least a couple hit their mark, but it was obviously not enough to stop the monstrosity. Soundlessly this time, it rushes toward you, and you slam the thick door behind you and find a box of bullets. You place ten more in the chamber and stand behind the counter, in a shooter's stance, gun pointed towards the door of the diner, while the door rocks with tremendous force. You can hear a hungry, slavering noise from the other side, it obviously wants you now. I few more strikes from the thing outside and the door will certainly burst upon, spilling whatever is outside the diner within 15 feet of you.
11111221.title: Go back out to try to fight again.

choices: Bash the creature with the gun.
Unload a few rounds into it's terrifying visage.
111112212.content:
Deciding it would be foolish to attack a creature such as- whatever the hell that thing was, you pry open the small doorway and scramble inside. The small hallway ahead is dark and foreboding, and the acrid scent of rust invades your nostrils. Fingering the gun to feel more secure, you pull the door closed and crawl on your knees, ripping the jeans you're wearing and scraping the flesh. Adrenalin kills the pain however, and you hear a loud crash in the diner, followed by a deafening roar. Fear wracks your body forcing you forward even faster. The door bursts open and the creature grips your leg.
Struggling against the creature, you realize that it's grip is to strong to get free from, and fear gives way to pure rage. You glare at the creature.
In an attempt to get free, you-
111112212.title: Flee through the passageway that you discovered...

1111122121.content:
You use all of your might to bring the gun down on the creature's hand, and the beast shrieks as the sound of crunching bone fills the chamber, reverberating in the hallway. It releases you and you crawl even faster, eventually reaching the end of the crawlspace.
You look at the gun in your hand, realizing that the force of the hit had bent the barrel, making the gun useless.
Throwing the gun into the darkness, you begin to rest. Before you can calm down, the gun hits something, and a wet *squish* sound echoes in the chamber.
Reaching around the floor, you find an old-fashioned lighter. Clicking the flint, you bring it to life and see a horrifying mass of tentacles covered in viscera. Pointing your hands as the thing like you still had the gun, you pull a trigger that is not there. The tentacles grab your hands and lift you off of the ground. Even more tentacles cover your body, binding you. as the creature brings you closer, the tentacles tighten, crushing your body, breaking every bone, rib, and your spine. Paralyzed, the creature brings you to a large thorny mass, and unable to resist, you are thrown into the gap. Pain wracks your body as the hole grinds your feet, then shins, then thighs while ejecting venom that keeps you from passing out. As your intestines are ground as well, you begin to enter shock from loss of blood. As you are pulled deeper, your ribs are ground to a pulp. Kept alive by the spirits of silent hill, you feel every nerve being destroyed. As at last your neck reaches the creature, all light begins to fade. Your last sight is the thorns below your eyes, and your agonizing death is ended when your skull is crushed by the mass. The creature gurgles, and falls silent.

Silent Hill has found another victim.
1111122121.title: Bash the creature with the gun.

choices: Chuck the gun at the creature.
Drop the gun and try to run.
1111122122.content: You raise the gun, point it at the creature's face, and squeeze the trigger twice. The monster's face blossoms with blood, and the creature howls in pain. You hurry down to the end of the crawlspace. You finally drop down into a pitch black room. You run your hands over the floor, desperate to find a light source. You come across a heavy metal lighter and click the flint, bathing the room with light. You see a grotesque mass of blood-spattered tentacles. The creature growls from an unseen mouth, and raises it's tentacles towards you. You raise the pistol, aiming at the mass, and squeeze the trigger. Five bullets hit the creature with a wet squish, and you pull again until there are no rounds left in the chamber. The creature growls even louder, and swings. You narrowly dodge it, and realizing the dead weight you are carrying, you decide to-
1111122122.title: Unload a few rounds into it's terrifying vi...

11111221221.content: You heave the gun at the creature in a desperate attempt to stun it long enough to run. By chance, the gun lands in the massive maw and lodges in the creature's throat. It grinds with the muscles in its mouth, breaking the gun. Unfortunately for the monster, the segments of the gun lodge in the creature's flesh. It growls fiercely while you stand, mesmerized, at your incredible luck. It grinds and grinds, driving the sharp metal deeper into it's gums. Finally, the beast growls once more and a spray of black, putrid blood spews on your clothing. The scent sends you reeling, and the creature dies as you pass out.
11111221221.title: Chuck the gun at the creature.

choices: Search for a weapon and go through the north door.
Forgo a weapon in favor of speed and go through the south door.
111112212211.content: An hour later, you come to. The first thing that crosses your mind is the little girl. Then, recent events flood into your memory. This, coupled with the putrid scent of the creature's blood on your clothing, makes you sick to your stomach, and you vomit on the floor. Heaving for several minutes, you realize that the shirt is what is making it worse. To remedy this, you strip your shirt and throw it aside. cold, but able to breath, you shiver as you relight the lighter. You look around and notice a door at either end. You-
111112212211.title: You awaken after an hour.

choices: Run back to the other room.
1111122122112.content:
Deciding you want to leave as quickly as possible, you leave through the south door. You open it and traipse through the rusty corridor. as you move you hear a strange and ominous sound.
SCRAPE SCRAPE SCRAPE
You-
1111122122112.title: Forgo a weapon in favor of speed and go through...

choices: Stand still and hope it's not actually seeing you.
11111221221122.content: As you move forward the scraping gets louder. Suddenly the sound is behind you, and you turn and stare in horror at a tall, ghastly figure. It has a multi-facetted pyramid like metal box on it's head, and wears naught but a bloody loincloth. It also carries a massive blade the size of a small Buick, and scrapes this as he walks along. It seems to see you, although it's not apparent how, and it moves slightly faster. You-
11111221221122.title: Continue forward.

111112212211221.content:
You stand stock still, hoping it can't truly see you. As it happens, he can. You realize this and try to run, but Pyramid Head grabs you by the shoulders. It's great hands are unnaturally strong, and you cannot get free. He flips you and hits your hand against the floor, and you are stunned. It rips the pants from you, and pry's your legs apart. Your vision goes black, but you still feel. As he forces himself inside of you, an intense pain erupts from your rectum. It thrusts and thrusts, too fast for your flesh to withstand, and your intestines rupture. As blood pours from your anus, the creature seems more exited. You feel it spasm as your heart stops from the incredible pain and shock. You die.
The monster throws your corpse at the wall, and your bones break from the impact. It lifts its knife and moves through the hall.


SCRAPE SCRAPE SCRAPE

11111221222.content: You drop the gun and attempt to flee. As you run, the creature sends a tentacle right at you. The tentacle pierces your chest, and another one impales your gut. as blood spurts and your intestines and feces leak to the floor, the creature picks you up. Your last sight is the gaping maw as it pulls you in, happy to have another meal at so easy a price.
11111221222.title: Drop the gun and try to run.

11112.content:
The little girl screams as you pick her up and raise her in front of you as a shield. You peek at the disturbing figure over her shoulder - he looks like a normal man, about in his mid-thirties. He's probably just the girl's father.

"Drop her." he commands.

"Sorry mister," you murmur, placing the sobbing girl on the ground next to. As soon as her feet touch the ground, she runs for the restrooms.

The man raises a hand, pointing at you from across the room.
"You are not one of them..."


"No I-" you try to reply, but the man suddenly flicks his wrist, and with a sharp jerk, your neck snaps, and you fall to the ground, dead.


You have died. Please go back to the beginning and try again.
11112.title: Kharma

1112.content: You motion to the girl to stay quiet by putting your finger to your lips. You slowly open the door and find no one there. You look back and the girl is gone. You walk back to the counter and find that she isn't there. You turn around to have a disfigured man standing in front of you. He whispers, "Can I help you?" He's standing inches away from your face. There's what appears to be a scar going down the side of his face. Fear has frozen your feet still, but you manage to say,
1112.title: The man in the diner

11121.content:
"Name's TC," the man smiles displaying his widely spaced and rotting teeth. Your stomach turns a little.
"It's good to see someone. There's been no one in this little place for quite some time. Get's lonely you know."

"Where'd the girl go?" you motion to the counter behind yourself.

"What girl?" TC stares at you quizically then a look of realization washes over his face. "Oh, you'd better come with me. It's really not safe around here after dark."
11121.title: No More Townfolk

111211.content:
Feeling like a cowardly fool, I followed him out to the street.
"The girl, she's still back there. We just left her. We have to go back."
"No goin' back, not from this place. Forget about the girl. She's just a worm on hook."
"What, hey show me the way out man. I can call the police and .."
"And what save the child, save the town, too late for all that. It's goin' take all we got, naw a lot more that, just to save our own skins."
Something creaked in the darkness. He quickened his pace. "Keep up or get left behind." He said as he took off running down the middle of the street."
I ran too but I could not resist the urge to look back. Should never have done that.
Darkness, like a living fog began to slowly rise behind us, coiling and weaving it's way over the glistening wet asphalt with serpent like purpose and subilty.
"Don't look at it moron." The man screamed from the only lit storefront in town, "It'll drain you dry. Look at me and run like crazy."
I bolted my head around and practically dove toward small of light the man was standing in.
"Help me" a small voice cried piteously. I turned my face looked down saw a little boy running several feet behind me.
111211.title: Run or die

choices: Run to catch up with the man
1112111.content:
You take a few steps out of the light with your hand outstretched towards the little boy, "Come on, quickly take my hand. It'll be okay." The little boy's face was shadowed from the foggy darkness. You could see that he was visably pale with dark circles around his eyes. Suddenly the boy began running at you more quickly than you could've expected, you stop moving. Something is wrong, the boy shouldn't be moving that fast and why does he have that evil smirk on his face..?
"Noo!" You felt this tightness encircle your arm and you realized that it was the man grabbing you pulling you back into the light just in time before the little boy was able to touch you. The little boy had risen from the ground and what seemed to be floating off in the air and into the foggy darkness. "You have to stay out of the darkness and away from them. You can't trust anybody here, understand?" I nodded my head, my head seemed to be the only thing that I could move. What was that little boy? How could he move so fast? Was the little girl the same thing? This place just seemed too weird for my liking.
"Here let's go to my place, it's just down the street a little ways." The man begun walking in the opposite direction of the diner. You turned your head to look around where the little boy had been.
"Well, you coming?"
1112111.title: Evil little boy

choices: TC explains more about Silent Hill
TC starts to explain before he is interrupted
11121111.content: You finally get to TC's house and step inside "What's your name" he asks as he slams the door shut and closes the door. You absently tell him your name as you look around. You notice that strangely the fog is inside the house as well. All of his windows and doors, except for the one you came through,seem to be boarded up. "Sit down" TC tells you as he motions a chair in his living room. "We'll have to stay here for about an hour" you sigh at the relief of being somewhere safe "Look," you say "I need to get home, I have to pick up my daughter from camp." TC laughs "I don't think that'll be happening anytime soon" You look at him quizzically "Why not?"
11121111.title: TC's

111211111.content:
TC cleared his throat, "Well, after many of the residents of this town passed away, strange things have been happening. It's like whoever comes here gets trapped inside one of their worst nightmares."
He sighs deeply, "Now we must face our most darkest secrets and regrets. There are creatures that hide in the fog, the darkness comes and we then have to fend for ourselves and find a way out, otherwise..." He pauses, a vacant look in his eyes.
"Otherwise, what?" You enquire.
He shakes his head, "Otherwise, we die!" TC snapped his head to attention as a sound attracts his attention.
Over beside a dusty table, again hides the girl. You stand and start to move towards her, but it isn't possible for TC grabs your hand and pulls you into the next room.
Right into a creature, spitting blood and oozing acid from various wounds on its body.
"Stay back!" TC screams, as he grabs a heavy object from a nearby shelf and heaves it in the creatures' direction. It staggers and lets out a grating moaning, before splitting into a million pieces and vanishing.
You can't believe that this is happening and TC is acting like this was something out of the ordinary, you shake you head as he begins to move off again.
111211111.title: An Unescapable Fate

choices: Touch the wall and see whats making it move like that
Go into the bedroom that you thought you saw a shadow in before the lights went
1112111111.content:
You take a better look around the small shack and notice there aren't many places the old man could have went. A smaller room to the left has it's door ajar. There is a bit of lamp light illuminating a dark figure. You creep closer in order to get a better look. Just then you feel a light touch on your hand and look behind you too see the little girl.

Her cheeks are tear stained creating small zig zag patters across her tiny face. She looks scared and you lean down to ask her why she's here in the man's house. She motions for you to come closer to her face, closer to her mouth. As you lean in expecting to hear her whisper something to you. The lights go out and you hear a terrible screeching sound.

It's so monstrous it seems to create a wind and life force all it's own. The lights come back on blinding you for a few moments. The girl is gone once again but so is the old man. The walls appear to be moving, something under their surfaces making absent circles like tiny worms. Curious you step closer reaching out a hesitant finger.
1112111111.title: Lights Out

11121111111.content:
You move a little closer and allow the tips of your fingers to touch the wall. The moving in them stops on contact. You're a little confused, but relieved at the same time. You close your eyes for a second and let your head drop down in an attempt to pull yourself together. All of this running around has you exhausted and scared.

All of a sudden, you feel the ground sway beneath you, almost as though a giant invisible wave has just passed by. Then you hear TC's screams coming from the other room. You take your hand off the wall and look at the spot it had just been on. It was a large black stain, and it was now growing out, extending with individual veins. The walls were alive once again. The excruciating screeching noise starts again, but is drowned out by TC's screams.

You are about to take off to find TC when you spot a door on the far side of the room that is not boarded up. You stop and quickly weigh your options...
11121111111.title: the wailing walls

smoke some magic mushrooms with prymid head and get really confused

1112111111112.content: Im Sorry To Say That Pyramid Head Didn't Care Too Much About Your Offer Because As Soon As He Opened The Door, He Crushed Every Bone In Your Body Into A Fine Dust With The Flat Side Of His Sword. Good Try Though! Maybe You Won't Become A Splatter On The Floor Next Time!
1112111111112.title: You Really Expected That To Work?

111211111112.content:
You work your way around the house. Since it's your first time being here, you're a little lost. Fortunately for you, TC screams again and you find your way. But what you see, rather what you don't see, isn't so fortunate. TC's face is half gone. The last remaining dark eye is opened wide in fear.

His screams are Earth-shattering. Slowly, you get dizzy. "This is why I never made it through medical school," you think yo yourself.

After recovering from that spell, you see TC is stark naked. The thing that holds him is staring. The smirk on its face is deadly. You realize now why TC told you not to look. You can't look away now. It is luring you closer. With each step taken, you try to stop yourself more.

But, you can't. And now you are inches away from the thing.
Alas! There is a light. A bit of light. And as you turn to see what caused this light, you see the little girl. Her hair greasy. Skin pale. She reminds you of someone. Maybe your mother, your sister, or perhaps of yourself, at a younger age.

"Come here," she calls. You don't know what to do. Should you listen to her or turn back to that horrible thing that has TC?
111211111112.title: Go help TC

choices: Be strong, for her if not for yourself!
Run like hell and get out of this place!
1112111111121.content:
With your last ounce of strength, you break your stare with the horrible creature. You know, without a shred of doubt, that this was TC's last moment, and he gave it to scream advice to you. You lunge into the light, crouching down in a fetal position by the little girl.

The next seven seconds are easily the worst, most horendous, vicious and terrible sounds you've ever had to live to hear. TC lets out a feral cry as you hear the tearing of flesh. Bone splinters and blood splashes as it cascades on the walls and pools down onto the floor. Pieces of him are torn free from his torso and flung with animalistic fury across the room. You shudder and sob, tears spilling like his blood as you hear your only friend suffering the worst way. Guilt tears you apart as painfully as the monster was shredding his skin. You could even hear it chewing on him. There was a gutteral, choked sob that you knew was the last sound of TC, and there was a loud crack, and the sound of his skull being crushed between the monster's hands filled the room. In those seven seconds, there had been more bloodshed and violence then you had witnesses in your entire life. And it happened to the only man who could've helped you.

You crouch on the floor, unwilling and unable to look up. Tears poured down your face as you were racked with large and remorseful sobs that you could not save him. You were now alone again in the eternal darkness of Silent Hill. The realm where your past was your present and future. The most fearsome place imaginable. A world of chaos, insanity and nightmares readying themselves to frighten you to an inch of your limits. If you weren't torn limb from limb, you would sucumb to the madness of isolation and your own regrets.

After what seemed like hours, but could not have been longer then a few minutes, you felt a soft, small hand on your head. Looking up, you stared into the girl's eyes... she was gently stroking your head and neck, soothing you sympathetically. Here was a seven year old girl calming a full grown adult, who should be able to stand up and protect this girl. Instead, your crying like a little child...
1112111111121.title: Salvation for damnation.

choices: Keep going in the direction of the light
11121111111211.content:
You grab the girl's hand and pull yourself up. You feel her eyes watch as your rise, watching you, waiting for you.

"Come on, let's get out of here." You tell her and take the lead, heading through the door that you had seen earlier. Expecting to be hit with a cool breeze as you step outside you are mistaken, all you feel is dead, still air. The fog just as dense as before. You look around expecting to see something, someone. Then you see something glinting in the distance through the thick air.

A thin arm rises and you see the girl pointing to the light, "Over there!" She calls out, her voice small but confident.

You find youself wondering how she is so strong when finding herself in such a situation. And you wonder where her parents are.

You nod your approval and begin heading towards the light, picking your way slowly through the darkness, the girl's hand small in your own. You get closer and closer, the light getting brighter with each step. Just inches from it now, you reach out finger tips almost brushing the heat from the light. Then it was gone.

Turning you peer down to look at the little girl. And she's gone.
11121111111211.title: Be strong, for her if not for yourself!

111211111112112.content:
"Where are you?" you whisper urgently. The darkness is like nothing you've experienced before; it's like you've been blind-folded, only there is no cloth covering your eyes. But it's not the pitch black that scares you as much as the fact that there are no sounds--no buzzing of insects in the night, no cars moving along some distant highway, no sounds of electrical humming from power lines above; nothing. The only thing you can hear are your own awkward foot steps as you grasp at air in search of the missing child.

"Little girl," you plead, for you knew she was your only hope of getting out of this strange place. "Where are you?" you finally cry out before breaking down in tears and crouching down, afraid of what you may walk into if you continue.

You try to retrace your steps and remember what you were doing before you woke up in that empty diner. How did you get there? The last thing you recall is talking to your daughter Kylie on the phone while in route to pick her up from camp. You were smiling while she crooned a song she'd learned that day during the farewell assembly. You can still hear Kylie's tiny voice in your ears, and it gives you the strength to stand up and begin moving forward again.

Before you can take you first step, you hear a low clicking sound a few feet to the left and behind you. It starts slow and then speeds up as it grows louder, like the tail of a rattlesnake before it strikes. It feels like your heart could burst through your chest, as you are nearly overcome with terror; but Kylie's sweet face is all you can think about, so you sprint forward into the blackness, unafraid of slamming into anything in front of you.

You immediately hear several more clicking noises coming from different directions and the sound of something dragging behind you.
111211111112112.title: Look for the girl

11121111111212.content:
You can't stand this place any longer!

"I'm sorry," you gasp to the girl as you sprint from the building. Remorse fills you as you hear the girl scream, the monster you saw before laughing maniacally. You sprint down street after street, leaping from light to light as monsters flooded the streets after you. You could hear the primal grunts, gurgles and terrifying roars as panic filled your chest. Your heart pounded in your chest as you dashed madly for an exit from this place.

Suddenly, something changed. The monsterous noises behind you changed, as if from rage to fear. You looked back to see a solid wall of humaniod atrocities, from deformed children, to things that looked as if two people had been sewn together. Some creatures simply writhed enigmatically and dripped black, corrosive acid. Not one of these monsters came any further.

You smiled, and turned forward again, only to find a giant wall in front of you. It seems you had literally hit the wall, except on top of this wall sat the little girl. Her eyes were black with the purest rage. She tilted her head eerily and raised her arm to you, flicking her wrist.

The sound of heavy breathing arouse behind you. You turned to face a monster that, though it possesed no deformity or injury, stroke such terror into you that your heart nearly failed in that on instant. A nine foot beast stood before you, completely human in shape, with a huge metal pyramid on it's head. The metal was stained with years of blood- blood presumably shed from the sword it weilded. An impossible, ten foot blade was perched menacingly upon it's sholders. It had huge muscles that bulged and throbbed with every twitch, breath, and movement. Your face drained of color as you beheld this great and terrible creature.

With one vicious twist, it swung the massive sword down. Should it have been closer, your life you have ended instantly. Unfortunately for you, it's brutally sharp tip sliced from your upper chest, down straight though your groin. You felt your trachea severed as you began gasping through the gaping hole in your chest. the blow divided your entire torso, tearing through muscle, but slilding perfectly through the gap in your rib cage. Your blood spurts eratically from you as you fall to your knees, your internal organs piling on the ground in front of you as you choked on the blood filling your lungs.

Finally, in Silent Hill's final message to you, the legendary Pyramid Head reaches down, plunging his hand into your gaping chest cavity and tearing your heart from your body. Your blood now gushes out rapidly as you collapse to the ground. He holds your heart high and crushed it in his grasp, showering himself in the blood of his most recent victim.


That's what you get for being heartless, and leaving the girl behind.
11121111111212.title: heartless.

TC is lying motionless on the floor next to an unmade bed. Dirty linen cascading down around his forehead. You step cautiously forward and reach down to pull the tattered sheet from his face. And when you do you see there is a terrible gash in his forehead. Yet there is no blood.

Jumping back in shock the bedroom door slams loudly and your breath is caught for a moment. Down on your knees you attempt to awaken the man. He is your only way out of this God forsaken place. He doesn't appear to be breathing but his skin is still warm and his eyelids start to flutter. As his eyes open you jump back again, there is something different about him. Your first thought is this isn't TC. Sliding your feet backward slowly trying to reach the door behind you the man rises from the floor.

His stiff body lumbers toward you, a scream lodged in your throat. "Hey kid, what happened? How long was I out?" you realize it was all in your mind, he's fine. You breathe a deep sigh of relief and instantly feeling like you should give him a hug, so glad that he's okay and that he's not... one of them.

You Throw your arms around TC. "Thank god you're ok." You say.
"Whoa calm down man. I'm fine. Just got a raging Headache." He says pushing away from you.
"sorry about that. I got a little carried away."
"It's fine kid. This place can be a little scary for new people."
TC goes to the bed and rips off part of the bedsheet and wraps it around the gash in his head.
"We should keep moving. We don't wanna be standing around in the same place for to long." He says.

Just then a cracking sound erupts in the room. The Closet door on the other side of the room bent inward.
A crack appearing in the middle.
"Let's GO! NOW" TC Yells.
You run out of the bedroom into the hallway, but it is not the same hallway you came from.
The walls are now a metallic rust color. The floor is a metal grate. You look down between your feet and through the grate you see nothing but blackness. Bare bulbs hang from the ceiling casting a eerie yellow light.
Two metal doors are a few feet down the hall.

You stop in your tracks. TC comes behind you and pushes you forward.
"No time to sightsee." He says as he pushes past you.
He runs down the hall, his footfalls echoing loudly off the metal grates. He turns a corner and his footsteps go silent.
"TC?" You shout down the hall. There is no answer. Silence fills the hallway.
From inside the bedroom a finally cracking sound tells you that the Closet door finally gave way.
You stand frozen in fear....

You open the door closest to you, but it was too dark for you to see inside. You decide to turn around and run after TC, but an unknown force pushed you into the darkness. You hear the door slam shut and then creaking noise. You lay on the cool wooden floor, too scared to move, but the shriek that you just heard made you jump to your feet.
"TC?" you called out, hoping for some reply from him. All you heard was the creaking noise.
The lights above you turned on by themselves, but they were dim. You could barely see the rocking chair that sat in the middle of the floor, rocking on its own. You turn around to go out the door you came in from, but it was gone. In its place was a picture of a middle aged man. His dark eyes were wide as was his smile.
You turn back around to see two doors. A white one on the left, and a dark wooden one on the right. You hear TC calling you from one of them, but you're not sure which one you should go through.
1112111111212.title: Try one of the other doors.

111211111122.content:
"I...I saw the little girl again," you stammer, "but then she disappeared. Now something is out there! Something horrible!" You can feel the last bits of your composure evaporating like water on a hot stove. "How are we gonna get out of here?! I just want to pick my daughter up and--"


         "Calm yourself down, girl!" TC snaps, ripping the sheets on the bed and tying it around his forehead. "Losing it isn't going to help you get back home!" He walks over to the door and pressed his ear up against it. "Us survivors haven't stayed alive this long by losing our senses everytime one of those things comes after us."


         "You mean...there's more people here?" you ask hopefully.


         "Yes." TC replies in a whisper, still listening through the door. "They are holed up at the old police station, a few blocks away from here." He moves away from the drawer and to a bureau in the corner. Shuffling through the drawers for a moment, he grabs a machete and a large knife. Handing you the knife, he says, "If we are going to make it, we will need these, though sooner than later, I hope. Lets get out of here."


         TC walks over to a large window and starts prying boards off, as you start to go to help, you hear a low, guttural groan from the other side of the door. Something pushes against the door, and, as if it is made of plastic, it extends inward and then back again.


          "It's him!" TC cries, "He's coming for us! Hurry, help me!"


         You run to his side and start pulling boards off as fast as you can. You hear the noise again, but this time, it's a deep, resonating shriek. Just as you get the last board off, the door bends inward and explodes, sending splinters flying.


         "GO! NOW!" TC yells. He grabs you by the arm and sends you hurling out the window. "RUN DOWN THE STREET TO THE STATION! RUN!"


         Having only a split second to decide, you steel yourself and...

Outside, the darkness has taken over. You swear you can see figures moving about but you hope that it's simply your imagination. Behind you, sounds of a struggle can be heard. TC was fending off whatever came through that door; you must keep moving. He'll take care of himself.

1112111112.content:
You decide that looking for the girl is your next option, despite TC's warnings. Slowly but surely you make your way to the front door and exit his place. The fog is thick and the air is cold but you persist and continue your search. A faint cry can be heard off to the left and you investigate. Again you notice the frail little girl staring up at you. "Who are you?" you ask. She says nothing. "What is your name?" She remains silent. Suddenly, a larger figure appears and you jump back scared and screaming. It is a male and his body is covered with various wounds and dried blood, as if he were attacked but managed to survive the encounter. You soon discover, as he gets closer, that he is indeed not a member of the living but not of the dead either. An open section of his chest shows where his heart once resided but has been ripped from his body. He is a lost soul, an undead creature left to suffer in this realm. You let out an agonizing scream and run as hard and fast as your legs will allow. The fog engulfs you and you soon realize that other "lost souls" are in the area. They wander aimlessly, the stench of death fills the air. Their souls would love to embrace the finality of death so that they may at last rest in peace instead of suffering through this miserable middle ground between life and the afterlife.

They are forced to "kill" those that enter this realm but their victims never truly die. They too become members of the walking dead, simply adding to the zombie population. You manage to slip by them because their movements are slow and methodical but you know that the possibility exists that the next encounter may be your last as a living being. You find a place to hide, the sun is rising. Soon the fog, and the dangers within it will be over.....for now.

You take a moment to rest, but you have chosen a very bad place apparently. Its not long before the walking dead find you they must have been attracted to you somehow. You move away from them, hoping the sun rises soon, you can see the pink sunrise, but no sun yet. You need to buy some more time... You look around for a weapon. Nothing but boxes, and books.

You reach into your pocket and locate your lighter. You had smoked your last cigarette a few years back but couldn't help keeping a lighter, it felt like a safety blanket. You knew it was irrational, but it worked to your advantage this time.

You grab one of the books and light it up it doesn't take long for the paper to catch fire... you begin throwing the fire books at your attackers. Some of them caught fire but didn't stop their pursuit, still moving slowly toward you. There aren't many books left to light but you continue lighting and throwing... One of your attackers is getting very close almost close enough to begin hand to hand, fight for your life, attacking. You throw your last book at the crowd behind him... and prepare to battle for your life.

Just as you throw your first punch, the sun's rays break the fog. It lifts immediately, your attackers seem to become part of the fog as it dissapates. As the fog lifts you see the little girl in the doorway.

choices: Walk out and forget the voice
Go and enlist TC in fighting the evil of Silent Hill
1112111112222.content:
No! You must enter this room, no matter what you may find. You place your trembling hand on the doorknob and slowly turn it. It creaks as you open it, then suddenly blinding white light pours out of the doorway and you find yourself swallowed by it. It is too bright to bare, so you close your eyes tight.
"You have finally come. You have good instincts to follow what you believe is right, even though you have no reason to believe it." The voice is very loud and deep, and seems to echo accross the indeffinate space.
"Don't ask me, I will tell you," admonishes the voice, predicting your question before you ask it. "I am here to bring order to chaos, as are you. You are here for a reason. While I have much knowledge, I have not the power to set things in motion. You do."
"Set what in motion?," you implore, trying in vain to match the volume of the booming voice. "What power do you think I have?"
"Once you know what I am about to tell you, you will have all the power. You must seek out the man who calls himself TC. Tell him the plan is once again in motion and that with his help you will destroy the evil that resides in Silent Hill." This is too much for you to understand. How does he expect you to do this.
"I know your thoughts. You will be able to do this. First you must find the place where all undead are made. There the souls of the dead were forced to remain on earth, though they long for the afterlife. Once there, you must fight your way into the main lab and retrieve the Token of Eternal Rest. After that TC will know what to do."
"Why not just send him, then," you ask in a rather harsh tone.
"I have once before. But he failed to complete the task. I have since realized my error in sending him. First, I should have known that there would be no way for him to fight his way through the mass of zombies who reside in the lab. He had no idea what awaited him. This is how he got his unfortunate disfigurement. I will give you a weapon this time. The Light of Dawn. It is a shard of ancient stone, known to harness the sun's light. No evil thing will dare approach you while you wield this. But beware. It's use is limited. Call upon its power only when absolutely necesary. My second mistake was to send him alone. I pulled you from your world into this one to remedy that."
"ME! Why me?"
"I searched for years to find someone with your instincts and your ability to deal with difficult situations. I am confident that you are the only one who is right for this possition." Your mind is racing to catch up with the insane details of this conversation. Are you really strong enough to take on a world of the undead? Is TC one to be trusted? It is all just to much for you to grasp.
"I must stress to you one thing. Understand that this is not a request. I brought you here to do this and so do it you must. Trust in TC even more than he trusts in you. He is meant to do this as well. I will hear from you when your task has been fulfilled." And with a loud crack the light dissipates, leaving you standing in a classroom in shambles, standing on the discarded papers that line the floor. Windows are broken and there is blood streaked along some of the walls. On the floor in front of you is a translucent yellow stone, so small you almost don't notice it is there. The Light of Dawn. You pick it up and examine it. Doubt floods your mind. Up until a point you viewed the mightily voiced being as some sort of wise, all-knowing god, despite the fact that he claimed to be responsible for TC's accident. But at the words 'I am confident', you began to wonder if he isn't just another selfish, fool of a being who has learned to play god. How much different is he from human and thus how much better equipped is he to set right the wrongs of the world. Who is he and how has he been appointed savior over the earth, in multiple dementions no less. You wonder if you should forget the voice and simply try and make out the best you can. But then how can you ignore the feeling you had about the little girl. You realize now that it must have been him, taking innocent form. You are no less at a loss for what to do after all this thought, but a choice must be made.

If ya met the same bein I did, then ya prob'ly guessed he's a trickster an' an illusionist. That little girl was prob'ly him, lurin ya into his realm ta feed ya false hopes.
