The beast falls and twitches an accusing twitch, sending a cool breeze up your spine.
You proceed to investigate the room; all it is is a storage room. You pray that you haven't trapped yourself, and look for another door. Lucky for you, there is one.
And it leads to a long hallway, at the end of which is the Exit. You are eager to leave the place so you rush to the door. As you close in on a door to your side, it crashes open, knocking you to the wall and stunning you. Out comes Pyramid Head, dragging behind him the raped corpse.
You panic. He drops the dead monster and bangs his helmet. He holds his hand out, seemingly reaching for you. He then drags his sword behind him. You stand up and bash him on his helmet, but your club just bounces off and makes him annoyed. He crashes the flat of his sword into you, knocking you further down the hallway. You struggle for air as he closes in, but your will to live isn't extinguished.
You piece together every ounce of your courage and stand up, breaking for the door. You slam into it, wincing as you turn the knob to open it.
It's locked.
Realizing it's over, you sit down and wait for Pyramid Head to finish you. Then the door beside you swings open. The girl you saw in the window sticks her head out and looks at you. Only, she looks evil, very pale and with black eyes.
"Great. 2 vs. 1." you mutter. She screeches again, forcing Pyramid Head backwards in agony. Then a great arm shoots out of the darkness of the room beside you. The pain eventually becomes too much to bear, and you close your eyes.
Everything faded.
1131212111.title: A Savior from the Shadows

11312121111.content:
You wake up to darkness, if you woke up at all. You open your eyes and find yourself in a dimly lit room, blood all over the walls and floor. You sit up, taking your flashlight out from your breast pocket and checking the room. There's nothing but a door and small square in the center of the room.
Picking it up you realize it's a cell phone battery, and there's a note attached.
You shall find this useful in the search for the truth. P.S. Don't call out, as it will not work. Just keep it.
Not sure if you should listen to the note, you just tuck it in your pocket and try to forget about it. You go through the door and find the whole room is covered in the same blood and rust, the floor turned to grating, and sirens in the distance. The Exit is locked, and so is the room Pyramid Head used.
Back in the tool storage room, you are preparing to enter into the main shopping room when you hear a faint static from somewhere. You look around, and see no radio or television or anything anywhere. You grab the cell phone and discover it has a radio feature. You consider shutting the radio off until a movement in the corner draws your attention.
The same no-armed creature is standing up, and it's staggering toward you again. Acting on instinct you bash it into oblivion with your club. You then check the tools on the shelves and boxes. They've changed to surgical tools, and there is a stretcher in one corner. Not wanting to know what is going on, you go to the entrance.
No Pyramid Head, no monsters, nothing. It's a bare room with no shelves or anything. The door from which you entered is covered in a tarp, and the air is heavy. You come to a door which Pyramid Head obscured, and enter to find two monsters.
You bash them with your club and kick to make sure they're down. They are. You find a table with only a box cutting knife and an ad for the diner upon it. You go back to the main room and cut the tarp off of the door. You exit to a similair scenario on the street. Hearing wings in the distance, you rush to the diner door.
You grasp the handle and dash inside. It's just like outside, but there is a stool in the center, the exact center. Upon it lies two gems: a ruby and a sapphire. You think you remember something like this on a movie once.
Choose the stone to leave the nightmare. Don't choose wrong, else the Punisher comes says a note on the stool.
So, choose one. Don't choose wrong, or else.
11312121111.title: A Blood-Stained Store

choices: Let the man wander off into your sunset.
113121211111.content:
"Fifty percent is better than nothing," you say to yourself, whispering a prayer. You grab the ruby and your first thought is an image of pyramid head or some other abomination, crashing through the ceiling, bursting up from the floorboards, or raping its way through the wall.

For five solid heartbeats, you brace yourself.

And for five solid heartbeats, nothing happens.

Then, something does. The sound of the back door opening? A ray of sunlight spills onto the kitchen floor-- you can see it leaking into the diner, out of place, a stark contrast to the fog and muffled screams saturating the rest of everything. You step toward the light. And hear the click of a pistol's hammer.

A man's voice, very businesslike, cuts the tension: "I thought you'd come back. Put it down." The barrel of the pistol jabs your arm holding the broken stool leg. "Now." You do it, hating yourself. But death from a pistol, you tell yourself, is just as final as death from anything else you've seen so far.

Rough hands shove you to the ground and a shoe-- an expensive one, judging by the way its point and heel dig into your back-- pins you there. "No matter how weird things get, there's always one constant: common fucking sense. Why take chances with your own life if you've got someone else's?" The foot pushes down harder, forcing out more of your breath. "I've been eying that demon's choice on the bar stool for the better part of today... if there is such a thing as day in this fucked up shitfest. In fact, I was even ready to make that choice myself..."

From the floor, you can still see the sunlight stretching across the cracked tiles. The light shadow of a shade tree is rocking gently in a breeze that must exist less than twenty feet out that back door... a breeze that may as well be twenty miles away.

"But then you showed up, groping around like a lemming that can't decide which lake to drown in. I knew it was only a matter of time before you came back. Lucky for me you did."

You decide that this man is an asshole.

"Anyway, if I said 'I hate to leave you here in this purgatory,' I'd be lying. Ta for now." The man's foot eases off your back. You see his shoe as he takes a step near where your cheek is plastered to the grimy floor. Then, almost as an afterthought, he casually, viciously, slams his heel into your kidney. "Don't say I never gave you anything, friend."

You struggle to breathe as the man walks purposefully toward your sunlight. Your mind races, searching for options. Anything. Anything at all. He's five feet from the door when you find your feet. And you remember the other choice-- the sapphire on the stool.

And punishment?
113121211111.title: Antagonism

choices: No thanks, there's got to be another way out of this nightmare.
1131212111111.content:
The room gets dark, and the door shuts disappearing into the wall.

"WHAT HAVE YOU DONE?" he screams at you.

If I can't leave neither can you, you throw the stone toward the asshole that was going to leave you here and roll over to the side of the building. Just in time it seemed. Pyramid head busted through the front door. You lay silently on the floor, fear preventing you from moving a muscle. Almost not breathing.

The man began screaming and dropped the sapphire and ruby. Pyramid head began twisting his body, it reminded you of the man in the bathroom. Horrified you decided to close your eyes. You opened them again to find Pyramid head relieving himself again raping the corpse of the man who was going to leave you here to die. A few moment later, Pyramid head disappeared into thin air and the stones where returned to the stool. A new letter lay under them.

"Beware if you have chosen, the stones change the outcome, one will lead out the other brings death"
1131212111111.title: Grab the sapphire.

11312121111112.content:
You screw everything, and stick to the principles of - I don't know - sanity, forgetting the stones. Thing was you were back to dusty, dilapidated, and decrepit square one. You were anything but sure on what to -

Wait. The man.

Automatic, your body shoots straight towards his ravaged corpse by the window. In your slapdash search, gross frissons of disgust run up and down, up and down your shivering spine seemingly caused by both the living silence that seemed to smile at you and the fact that this carcass was alive until just seconds ago. You find it.

The pistol. Silver. Heavy and hot. You're no arms dealer, but you'd say this was enough ordinance to last, at least for a while. Hopes start to rise inside of you. Guy might even have a-

Serendipity.

Gasping after hearing the ring, your left hand haphazardly goes for his shirt pocket... followed by his electric rise to grope at you. "Aaaah!" You scream as pure fear and instinct drive you back. Stupidly, you don't grab enough common sense to unlatch from his pocket and drag him TOWARDS yourself!
You both crash square into the metallic counter hunted by a dominant cry that blows out a small fraction of your pain.

Meanwhile, his vile, distorted flesh mound of a face is already vis-a-vis with you.

There's no other option. You do it. In two dashing seconds, the barrel punts against his head, discombobulating him, and then you pull the trigger.

BANG!

It's a violent pop. As the blood spurts across your face, you're stunned beyond any breath-related movement. Flashes of what he had done and said to you later, however? And you're up in valiance. Survival. This was survival. Kill or die. Strength was key.

Almost in response to having thought that, the phone repeats its eerie ring. Repetition of ring... The Attack... Strength... Fear.

Answer it?
11312121111112.title: No thanks, there's got to be another way ou...

choices: You hang both the phone and her neck up.
113121211111121.content:
There's a specific rapacity in your mind for information that overbears the lingering and, might I add, foolish paranoia that the man was still alive. He couldn't possibly be alive! You shot him right in the head!

The cellphone only seems to grate against reality harder. You exhale. Decision utilizes resolve. And tremulously, your hand plods downward, sweat and fear with it. At the same time and rate, second thoughts snake into your ears. There was no way. Absolutely no way he was... still... al...ive....

Bulging denim. The illusion dissipates completely as you hastily burrow and exhume the cellphone from his pocket. Flip. Green button. "Hello?"

It was almost as if you caught her midstream. Penetrating through the static, the girl's voice had all your pores bristle with surprise. "-LO! HELLO! Is anyone there!? Please - God - I don't want to die! Ple-e-ea-se... ANYONE!?" It was terrifying. Like all the pain and anguish and fear and fire was with her right now. Frantic. Desperate. Willing to sell her soul for a moment's peace. You rightly infer that she'd been her probably a lot longer than you have... that she would not last much longer before she would end it all... that she needed you right now.

Two questions held your lips place, however:

Who was she?

Did you even need someone as destroyed as her?
113121211111121.title: Answer it.

choices: Give into fear and leave your wife and child to their fate.
Grimace bravely, lay your head down and fall back asleep to rescue them.
113121211112.content:
You jolt upright in a double bed, and rove your eyes around the room. You are in a large bedroom with a chest of drawers to your right and a cupboard to your left. Lying next to you is your beautiful wife. You watch her as she tosses and turns under the duvet, her face a grimace of pain, but there is no visible reason why this should be so.
She mutters something nearly indistinguishable, 'No, I want to leave...'
You try to shake her awake, try to free her from whatever nightmare she is having. You look down and see her pregnant bulge forcing the thin red duvet cover above her. You are almost certain that she is also trapped in a nightmare as you were, and she won't wake up despite your efforts. It seems you have two choices available.
113121211112.title: Choose the sapphire

1131212111121.content:
You go to make a sandwich. Much safer. When you come back your wife is lying in a pool of blood, her stomach ripped open, and you hear grunting. As you walk closer you see that she is dead, and your child's small weak body has been ripped tp shreds. You notice that the grunting is faded and is not coming from nearby. Listening carefully you recognise the sexual groans of pyramid head.
Nice one, you sad excuse of a man, it seems that pyramid head found your wifes body in the nightmare. Proceed to go mad with guilt, start raving about the nightmare and get locked away in a hospital for your raving.
I suggest going back and gathering up the courage to go back to sleep, for a more satisfying continuation.
1131212111121.title: Give into fear and leave your wife and child to...

choices: The door directly in front of you.
1131212111122.content:
It isn't long before you slip back into your nightmares. Your wife is nowhere to be found, and you know that to get her and your child out alive, you must find them.
Still clutching the sapphire in your palm, you glance around. You are in a new place now. It's a white room with a blue ceiling, and there is one door on each of the four walls of the room. You look up at the ceiling once more, and see that there are words written in a strange loopy handwriting. Choose wisely. If your choice is correct, you will find a way out. However, if you do not, you will be doomed for all eternity.
You stash the gemstone in your jeans pocket and clasp your hands together in an attempt to pray for guidance as to which door is the right one.
Something is leading you to enter...
1131212111122.title: Grimace bravely, lay your head down and fall ba...

1131212112.content: Honestly, what the hell made you think you could take it? The first hit just clanked it's helmet, and then he grabbed you in a mighty chokehold. You managed to break free, but then, of course, he cleaved you in half with his sword. You are a moron if you thought you could take Pyramid Head. Running is your best option. So, go back, and choose "Run!" unless you don't want to continue. Trust me, you have a better chance running than fighting him. If you haven't played SH2, than you should. It'll help you out in the future, I'm sure.
1131212112.title: What a fool!

113121212.content:
Ever disobedient you decide to forget what the voice told you to do. This involves staying away from the hardware store, so you exit the diner and walk in the opposite direction. The fog begins to get thicker and thicker, with noises and groans increasing around you.
You break into a run, feeling scared and starting to regret your decision to leave the safety of buildings. As you think this you see a small shed ahead of you, which you run toward, throw the door open and bolt the door behind you when you enter.
The groans that you heard outside now seem to be converging on you. Terrified, you wipe the glass clean of condensation from your ragged breath. You squint into the fog.
As you do, you see a disgusting creature present itself about ten feet away. It was a sickly yellow colour, with orange boils and blemishes on its slimey skin. It stood about seven feet high and thick. It reminds you of a venus fly trap with arms and legs, it's leaflike appendiges swaggering towards you. It had mouths covering it's ozzing body and they snapped hungrily at the air. It's large fly trap mouth opened revealing gums but no teeth, and a human arm was stuck toward the back of its gaping maw, sticky with white gunk.You scream in fear and open the door, but see another one of the monsters, this time purple, about five feet away approaching sluggishly.
You know there are at least two of these monsters outside now, and you can either hole up in the shed or make a break for it past the plant like monster.
113121212.title: Disobey the voice,

1131212122.content:
You decide you wouldn't make it past the groping arms of the creature, and lock the door again and sit down. You hear tearing sounds as the creatures reach you and they let out a high pitched groan. One of them smashes the window you looked out with it's arm and the small mouths on this limb bite into your chest, ripping chunks of flesh away.
You scream in protest but there is nothing you can do, there are no weapons in here. The arm retreats and the head bursts through, splintering the wood. It let out a screech of truimph and pulls you into its maw while it's competitor watches sullenly, beat to his meal. Your cries are stifled as you are pulled headfirst into the creature, smelling it's sickly rotten stench as a bubble of orange puss bursts and splashes hot liquid over your chest and legs. When you are gone, the creature turns away and ambles into the mist.
I'm afraid this is one nightmare you won't be waking from.
1131212122.title: Shelter!

choices: Inspect the pattering on the upper level
See what is through the open doorway
11312122.content:
You decide that the voice is just too creepy to obey and will probably lead you to something you don't want to be involved in. Of course, you don't really want to be involved in any of this.

Instead, you disregard its words and traipse across to where you saw the girl's face. It turns out to be a school, though it's rundown and obviously in shatters. Half the exterior is blackened as though plagued by a fire.

Swallowing, you make your way into the building, hearing a clatter as the door rips off its hinges. You shudder when the noise causes what sounds suspiciously like running feet to patter across one of the rooms on the upper levels.

The noise worries you but you want to know about that girl. She could be upstairs, though you cannot tell that for sure. It could be someone else upstairs and you may find the girl in one of the rooms on the bottom floor. An eerier sound that makes you shudder even more comes from an open doorway down the hall. Now you're not sure what is the smarter choice.
11312122.title: The School

choices: Search the main area of the diner.
113122.content:
Things are never really that easy. Before you pressed the button, you certainly knew that this would be the case.

When you try to turn it on, the phone does not light up. It does not emit a welcoming jingle that would usually make you want to clamp your hands over your ears and run around a room full of mousetraps just to not listen to it. And it does not give you a dial tone.

However, although the phone appears to be dead, the emptiness that you hear when listening intently into the earpiece seems a little too complete. Kind of like towering in the dark on the edge of a deep precipice, without anything echoing back.

Like all the noise has been sucked away into a vacuum of empty space.

"Great..."

The hope of survival, of getting help had distracted you from the gruesome scene within the bathroom, but now the stench of death and rotting flesh cloud your senses once more with lightening rapidity.

It's time to get out of here.

A hasty exit brings you back to the main room of the diner, and all of a sudden you're sure the telephone is emitting a very slight white noise, like a radio that isn't tuned to a broadcasting frequency. But when you lift it to your ear, and try pressing the number keys... Nothing.

Must have been your imagination.

Where to look next...
113122.title: Life Is Never As Easy As The Movies...

choices: Investigate the rest of the diner.
Go outside to find out why you are here.
1131221.content:
Slowly, you push open the door. The stench slaps your nostrils and you immediately cover your nose and mouth with your hand. You almost decide not investigate when you suddenly hear a child's voice coming from one of the stalls.
"Hello"
The sound of your voice bounces off the molded tiles. Again you hear whispering and laughter. Eventhough, you are sure that certain death awaits you, you are filled with a slight sense of hope. Hope that you might get to talk to a live human, no matter what the age. You make your way to the last stall. Stepping lightly and as slowly as you can.
"Hello"
Again you hear laughter as you open the stall door. Knowing for sure that there is a child or two behind the door, you see nothing. Suddenly you are startled by a fast moving shadow behind you. You turn to look and see the bathroom door fly open and shut quickly. All hope has left you and now only fear fills you. You turn to exit the bathroom and your new phone starts making noises. Certain that it is not your imagination, you put it up to your ear. You hear children laughing and then hear a sharp, loud voice. It tells you to get out. Convinced that the phone is possessed, you throw it against the wall and it shatters. Staring at what you have done, the phone is still talking to you. You now run out of the bathroom.
1131221.title: Go into the other bathroom.

choices: Search the rest of the kitchen for clues.
11312211.content:
You crash into the counter and stop, trying to control your panic. You have to keep a clear head and try to figure out how to get out of this nightmare. You see double swinging doors behind the counter. They must lead to the kitchen. Maybe there is a clue somewhere in there.

You approach the doors cautiously, fearing what may lie on the other side, yet anxious to find some answers. You push the doors open and enter a scene of total chaos. Flour and grease coat all the surfaces...all except one. The wall facing you is white with large ragged red letters spread across it. The writing appears to have been done by a finger dipped in blood! It reads "All who enter here are lost--RUN." Drops of blood crawl down the wall from each tortured letter of the message.
11312211.title: What's in the kitchen?.

choices: Try and save the girl. She deserves life, no matter how horrifying.
Heed the warning and run outside the diner, into the mists of Silent Hill.
113122112.content:
The bloody message has long dried up and hung against the wall in a congealed splatter, like ketchup left lying on a plate for weeks untouched. You swallow audibly and walk slowly forward into the dimly lit kitchen, grimacing as your feet crunch over broken glass and plates. "RUN" the words seem to leap out from the wall at you, but you ignore them, and keep walking, looking around.
A spurt of laughter suddenly erupts behind one of the countertops, startling you. It's a child's laughter. You turn, and are immediately filled with dread.

In front of you sits a large oven. The dials seem to glow red. You lean forward, and put your hand on one, then jump back as the lights flicker, than go completely black. You fumble around in the darkness, cutting your hand on something sharp. A slick wetness
spreads over your palm slowly, and you know it's blood.

Abruptly, a humming sound fills the air. You look down, puzzled. You see a red glow start to illuminate the inside of the oven. Slowly, you kneel down. You peer in, and scream, backing up on your hands and knees, your bloody hand sliding over the floor.
A gleeful face peers at you from inside the oven. A child's face. Laughing, laughing, joyfully. It's a girl, with long, ragged hair, and distinctly yellow eyes. She grins at you, bathed in the red light of the oven's heat, and suddenly, her hair catches fire. She opens her mouth and screams at you, revealing horrible black teeth. You stare back in horror, feeling the blood on your palm mix with your sweat.

The message on the wall looms in your mind: RUN.
113122112.title: The Kitchen

1131222.content:
You decide to search the main area of the diner. It's dim to sight, the fog outside the windows creating a gloomy atmosphere that seems to envelope the whole place. You begin your search beind the counter, coming up with nothing but the cash register and a couple of old magazines obviously there to keep away the boredom. No need for them now. On the other side of the counter you count eight booths and a few tables next to the window.

You begin your search of the booths, checking the first one with an intense scrutiny. The red, plastic seats creak under your weight as you crawl to the very back and check the seats as well as under the table. You find nothing. You check the second booth and again come up with nothing. The third and fourth are the same.

Your search is beginning to feel fruitless when you enter the fifth booth. There, on the floor under the table, you find a purse. Picing it up you glance around the diner first, feeling unsure and like you're invading privacy. However, you know it's a chance you have to take.

You open up the black material and search through the purse, gasping when you find the ID inside.
1131222.title: Search the main area of the diner.

1132.content:
You barge into the bathroom and stop short suddenly. There's someone in here! In all this panic and searching for clues you'd forgotten other people might be around.

The person has long purple (purple?!) hair stretching all the way down her back. It almost completely covers her white shirt. Amazingly, the shirt is clean enough that it seems to glow against the background of dirt and dust.

You see part of her reflection in the dust-covered mirror in front of you, although you can't really make out more than her fluorescent green lipstick. As you close the door behind you, she leans forward slightly.
1132.title: There's someone in here!

choices: push the girl off of you
tell her you are either a guy or a girl.
11321.content: "Thank God!" the girl sobs. "I thought the virus had killed off everyone else in town!" She reaches out to cling to your shirt. "You're the first person I have seen since my boyfriend was dissected. By the way.. " she looks at you strangely. " .. what the hell are you doing in the womens restroom?!? You LOOK like a guy.. maybe I'm just wrong."
11321.title: Gender Confusion

choices: Go upstairs to check out the rooms
Try to find a way out of the house
113211.content: You pushed the girl off your body as her hands grabbed the collar of your shirt. The girl laughed hysterically followed by muffled voice. You ran away as fast as you could, trying to leave the horrible sound she made. Out of breath, you slowed your pace into little jogs. Wondering where you were inside the gigantic house, you tried to harden yourself, telling yourself not to panick. Somehow it was useless, the house was too quiet. Every little sound made you jump. Was there anything you should be afraid of? And why did you feel scared? What was haunting you? A door creaked upstairs.
113211.title: Why should you panick?

113212.content: "Well," you stammer... "in case you were extremely near-sighted... I will tell you! I am a
113212.title: I am not Pat from SNL!!  (or:  Clarifying the Obvi

choices: ask her why she thinks that the two of you must leave.
push her away like an insensitive tough-guy and try to further explore the women
1132121.content:
"Oh," she expresses plainly. "I was not sure. You look kind of girlish. Well, either way... we need to get out of here SOON!!"
She almost embraces you and sobs for a while uncontrollably on your good shirt.
1132121.title: "You Look Girlish"

choices: Leave the bathroom, and take her with you.
11321211.content:
"Listen, lady," you respond, trying to sound calm. "First tell me what the hell is going on here."

She cocks her head, disbelieving.
"Are you goddamn kidding me!? Where the hell have you been!?"

"I just woke up here," you state, as if it were the most normal thing in the world to just 'wake up' in a strange, scary town. "I don't remember anything. Not my name, not my life story. Hell, I barely remembered my gender..."

"Seems you're one of the subjects," the girl says. "Those damn scientists have scrambled your brains. Look, it's all a long story. Bottom line is, there's a bunch of bad shit happening and we need to get the hell outta here!"
11321211.title: Amnesiacs... what would horror be without em?

113212112.content:
You do not know what else to do and the girl looks really scared so you tell her to come with you. She comes very willingly. The two of you leave the diner and you notice that strange mist has gotten thicker. You tell her to stay close and she nods, clutching your arm and huddling in closer. Being lost in a strange town had its perks.

The two of you are walking and she stops dead in her tracks. Confused, you follow her terrified stare and your heart almost stops beating. You see strange shadows moving through the mist and one of them, larger than the rest, is coming straight at you and your female companion.

You look around for a weapon to defend yourself with and you hit soemthing with your foot. Looking down you grin a little and bend down to pick up your new weapon. It is a...
113212112.title: Armed and Dangerous

choices: Hit it with the axe to make sure it's dead.
1132121121.content: You reach down to pick up a smallish axe with a broken handle. You push the girl behind you, acting braver than you feel. You hold up the axe as the figure comes close, and then it collapses in front of you with a moan.
1132121121.title: Axe

11321211212.content:
As your toe touches the creatures ribcage, it begins to tremble. The air around it shudders like waves on a hot day. Black smoke belches between blackened teeth, and the dark creature dissipates into smoke, spreading black spots across the night sky.

“What the Hell was that thing?” you ask.

“We....we don't know,” she replies. “It's been taking people from the town for months now. Some say it was a virus, but I'm not sure its that simple.”

“Sounds interesting. Any idea what we should do now?”

“Well, I want to get over to the lighthouse at the other side of town. I have friends there who can help. They're trying to find a solution. Maybe you can help.” She touches your arm.

“It's night, should we wait here for daylight? There could be more of those things.”
11321211212.title: Prod it with your toe.

1132121122.content:
You hold the rusty crowbar in your hands. It makes you feel stronger, more powerful. That is, until the creature hurtling at you comes closer. You see how hideous the monster is with six legs it seems to crawl upside down, its mouth hanging open in a gruesome scream. It moves fast like a spider and is almost on you.

You shove the girl out of the way and hear her hit the ground with a hard thud, but it did the trick, the creature comes for you. It scuttles after you, seeming to move faster and faster, legs like a steam train.

Raising the crow bar you wait until it gets closer, mouth opening wider to expose a wide row of razor sharp teeth. It is just about to pounce when you bring the crowbar down with an almight crash. It smashes into the creatures head as it lunges with a dull crack, sending the fiend to your left. It falls to the floor, a yellow liquid spurting from the wound you created with your new weapon.

What now?
1132121122.title: Rusty Crowbar

11321211222.content:
You run over and pick up the girl with your right hand, a rush of adrenaline sparking your strength. You grip your new trusty weapon tightly in your left hand.

"Come on," you grab her hand and begin running. You don't know where you're going but you're running, away from the monster that just tried to eat you. You can't get the images of it's huge, glinting teeth out of your eyes. And those legs.

"You should have killed it!" she yells at you as you run.

"Shut up," you mumble although she doesn't hear.

You are out of breath by the time you stop. But you're not allowed much rest when you hear a static noise start up.

"Oh no," a new sensation of dread engulfs you as the girl speaks.

"What?" you ask.

You wail in panic, and in a far off portion of your mind, you notice how thick the fog is, as the bullet's path was traced down the street by the circular rupture in the mist.

Suddenly, the formerly rear shadow burst from the fog. The once human looking figure was now only a walking pile of mottled, yellow flesh wrapped in tattered and filthy clothes that were no more than rags now. This time, you meet your target, and it promptly drops.

As if on cue, you howl in unearthly pain as your favored arm is bitten by an unseen foe. With your adrenaline glands pumping on overdrive, and with the consistency of the sound, the sucking sound had grown almost inaudible. You hadn't realized how close the other shadows had gotten.

Still gripping the pistol, you fire a shot uncontrollably from the searing pain on your arm. The slug harmlessly strikes the pavement and ricochets out into the fog.

You begin to feel many cold, dead hands scratching and grabbing at you as you spin in a frenzy of terror, attempting to shake free of the creatures. A cold, damp smell begins to harrass your nostrils.

You're unaware of it, but you're screaming at the top of your lungs. You scream mostly out of fear, although, the first attacker is still sinking it's teeth into your bicep. Reaching over with your empty hand, you grab the gun from your now useless arm and stuff the muzzle into the assumed head of the biter. You moan at the softness of the flesh and the portion of brain revealed from the muzzle induced hole.

click

No, that can't be.

click

The gun is empty.

You're sure you have atleast one more round, pulling the trigger once more.

click

Although one bullet wouldn't get you out of this, it would atleast put to rest the uncontrollably biting creature. Maybe then you can break free from these gently fleshed demons long enough to reloa--

"Aaaaggh"

You are bitten harshly again, this time on your thigh. The reaching hands are gaining a better grip.

With the butt of the gun, you thrash at the creature gnawing on your arm. You beat away bits of decayed brain and skull, to no avail.

As you drop to one knee, you feel yet another bite, this time into the back of your neck.

You moan weakly now as you start to feel the intoxicating effects of blood loss. Still, you drop the gun with heavy clack, and reach for your pocket with the box of bullets.

Just as you wrap your fingers around the small box, you are bitten on the forearm, causing the box to slip from your fingers just as it leaves the folds of your trousers.

The small, cardboard ammo case spits bullets across the pavement, landing in dissaray with tiny, metallic pattering sounds.

"Please..."

You're talking to noone in particular, knowing you're death will arrive in minutes, maybe seconds.

You fall once more, to all fours for a moment, then onto your chest, as if you were trying to embrace the whole street. You don't know how many mouths are biting you know, nor do you care.

You're slowly letting go. The pain is long gone, and your final thought is where that final bullet went.

You remember now.

You remember the fear that caused you to unknowingly(until now) fire two slugs into the chest of the creature that first crept up behind you.

You mouth the words "son of a..", unable to finish even the muted form.

A warm trickle of blood leaks from your lips, down your cheek, onto the pavement.

Vaguely, you sense the hair on the back of your head being torn from your scalp in a vicious bite.

You close your eyes, waiting. Waiting for your last breath.



THE END
121121.title: Up close and personal

choices: Follow her into the church (trust her)
Take your chances on the street (distrust her)
1211222.content:
A woman down the street in front a massive, cyclopean church screams again as she is beset by two "hell-babies"!

You run desperately to her to save her and, with gun drawn, fire into the backs of both demons. They drop to the street lifeless and vanish into a pile of ash which blows away in a chill wind.

"Thank you! Thank you young man! Come quickly! Into the church! It is not safe out here!"

She runs frantically to the door of the church and props it open, "Come on! We haven't much time!"
1211222.title: The Woman

12112221.content:
Your radio begins emitting static and you frantically race for the church! You step inside and she slams the door behind you just as monsters start to appear outside.

"Don't worry, you're safe now." She assures you.

You take a seat on one of the few pews that aren't rotting and bloody.

"You look thirsy, young man. Would you like something to drink?"

You thank her for the offer but politely refuse. She leaves the room silently.

You sit there and ponder your situation and the woman enters again. She holds in her hands a mug.

"Here you go, young man." Was this woman hard of hearing? Since she's already gotten the drink you decide you might as well go with the flow.

You gulp down the ice-cold liquid and it tastes great. In fact, it tastes perfect! It's your favorite drink!

"Wow! That was my favorite!" You exclaim in surprise.

"I know." She says as she smiles at you.

You begin to feel dizzy. You slur a question or two as you lose conciousness and hit the floor.

Who knows how much time had passed before you woke up. You open your eyes, still dizzy and look around.

You are ...
12112221.title: The Drink

121122211.content:
Still dizzy, you sit up in the morning light. You look around the room and slowly recognize where you are.

It's your hotel room. You get out of bed and stretch.

Damn. What a weird nightmare!

You gather your things and check out of the hotel downstairs. The receptionist tells you that she hopes you enjoyed your stay.

You get in your car and head home. That was a great vacation. (Despite the weird dream.)



CONGRATULATIONS! YOU'VE REALIZED SILENT HILL WAS ONLY A NIGHTMARE! YOU'VE MADE IT OUT ALIVE!
121122211.title: A Dream

12112222.content:
Acting as macho as you can in the face of hell, you yell to her from the street.

"Sorry, babe! I think I'll take my chances with the demons!"

Her face turns extremely angry and with hatred she shouts, "Then die like the rest!!!"

She slams the front of the church and that is the last you see of her.

Wow.

You don't know why she got so pissed but you have to keep moving.
12112222.title: She's Pissed!

choices: You keep walking in the opposite direction
You investigate the black shape, lying motionlessly
1212.content:
Outside the diner, deep from the fog, you hear a low, humming sound. It persists in unison with the radio's static getting louder and louder in this direction. However, as soon as you turn your back on the source of the noise, it fades slightly.

You grip the gun, pul it from your pocket and hold it out in front of you as you start venturing toward the sound that is slowly pulling you to it. A strange, grunt eminated from a shape just to your left and you point the gun. before thinking twice, still rirgid with fright and adrenaline spurned, you pull the trigger.

A loud thump hits your ears and shocked, you approach the massive, black shape that just fell a few yards from you.
1212.title: Wrong move?

choices: Stand your ground and wait out the sound.
Try to sneak around along the side past it.
12121.content:
Only a fool or a character in a poorly written horror movie would blindly approach the still shivering black mass on the street only feet before you. The gun, still warm in your hand from unloading the loud, unnerving round into the creature, seems to be bringing you less comfort as the radio, slipped half-hazard between your belt and dark blue jeans, begins to pick up the faintest sounds of interference. The sound begins to resonate, the frequency growing ever strong by the minute as the creature on the ground stops shivering and lays motionless. Still the radio continues to moan louder.

You turn around and head back, past the shelter of the rustic restaurant and briskly venture through the blanketing fog, unsure of your destination but willing to try anywhere that might silence the grainy static that is still blaring from the radio. The buildings on both sides of the street look desolate, covered by a coating of soot and age, they all blend together, forming the walls of the canyon down which you find yourself blindly stumbling.

The radio stops suddenly, and then a new noise, the sharp, violent scrapping sound of metal being dragged slowly across a hard surface in the distance begins, ever so slowly to come at you. Frozen in your tracks you try to discern any distinguishing characteristics of the harsh sound but all your mind can do is cringe as if fingernails were constantly being dragged slowly across an endless chalkboard.

Before you the sound is still masked by the dense fog, but suddenly it dawns on you that fog shouldn't float slowly to the ground and collect on the surfaces, as the thick, continuous waves of particles floating down from somewhere in the ominous sky above are doing. Ash? Sticking out your hand you catch on of the chalky thin flakes and holding it between your fingers it leaves a pitch black streak upon your pale hand. It is ash.

Suddenly, the radio, which had gone silent crackles with a pop, then a low steady crumpling begins to grow. The dragging sound, once distant now feels remarkably closer, the radio growing proportionally louder as it closes in on you. Surrounded on two sides by the barren gray walls of buildings, and on the other two by dense walls of ever-falling ash in habited by an unknown danger that is narrowing in on your location you have to act, before it is too late.
12121.title: Canyons and Crossroads

choices: try to get in the car beside you.
121211.content:
You decide against your better judgement to stick it out, and see what is making this grinding noise. just when you think the ash blinds you, it clears just enough for you to see something running on the ground in front of you. A dark brown mass swarming, you see that it's just a bunch of roaches. But that doesn't explain the sound, you say to yourself.
Just then you hear the grinding sound again, only now it's right up on you, and getting quicker. the ash clears a little more and you see the most hideous 'thing' with what looks like a red, pyramid-shaped box on it's head, dragging behind it a HUGE ass sword.
121211.title: Pyramid head

1212111.content:
Cars have too much of a capacity to fail, you decide, trusting to your own legs to get you to safety. Thankfully those years spent on the treadmill serve you well and you put a good distance between you and the pyramid-head monster.

The ash falls still, and befeor long you find yourself parched and dehaydrated. Weary and dizzy, you stumble on until you see a Fire Truck by the side of the road. You want to explore it, possibly even hide inside it and lock the doors. From behind you the faint sound of scraping metal reaches your ears. Do you...
1212111.title: Flee the scene

choices: Try to ram the monster with the firetruck
12121111.content:
You know you will not be able to run forever, and now that you have put some distance between you and the monster, you decide it won't hurt to try the door of the cab. You tug on the handle, but the door is locked.

"Damn." You mutter under your breath. You are about to walk away when you decide to check the passenger side door on the off chance. It opens!

You look around the cab of the truck. You climb up in the passenger seat and close the door behind you, as an extra precaution. You look around the cab of the truck. There is a pile of papers by your feet. You pick them up. They're wrinkled and crackle. It it obvious they got wet and have dried. Most of them are stuck together and the ink has run. You toss them back down.

There is a cup holder between the driver and passenger seats with a thermos in it. The cup that goes with it is missing, and you look around the cab for it, but can't find it. You're too thirsty to care and untwist the lid. You worry about how safe it is to drink the liquid inside and you smell the contents of the container. All you smell is the plastic of the thermos itself.

The scraping sound in the distance pulls you from your thoughts. As you look up, you notice that the key is in the ignition. You shake your head not believing your luck, but as the scraping gets louder, you decide it's too good a chance to pass up. You slide into the driver's seat and put the thermos back in the cup holder. You take a deep breath and turn the key. The engine starts!

This is way better than running! Then again... is a firetruck big enough to kill a sword wielding pyramid monster?
12121111.title: Vehicle

1212112.content: You try with all your might to open the car door, but its like it's welded shut. The door wont open, and now the monster has caught up with you. He swings his sword, and your body is sliced in two. The roaches crawl over your warm, still twitching body and devour you within minutes.
1212112.title: Live by the sword...

choices: Leave now, and look for the next best bet, or a way out of SH.
121212.content:
You spot a large fairly empty-looking, blue recycling bin off to the right a bit. Panicking from the lack of options and time, you rush over to it. Yeah, yes, you think quickly to yourself, I can fit in there fine. Without wasting a second you lift the light-enough bin over you, ignoring the small shower of rotten foods and dirty old papers and wrappers you quickly duck down inside, careful not to make anymore noise. Ugh, slap yourself, in your hastened panic you forgot to turn off the radio! The hulking sounds of a large . . . creature? Can be heard puffing and wheezing, presumably from all the thick smoke and ash it endured for God knows how long. The massive metallic object it drags along can be heard, though muffled by the thick plastic around you, it still managed to flood your body with goosebumps of the biggest kind.

You struggle to reach the volume on the radio and after an uncomfortable angling reach, your chicken wing shaped arm reaches it. Your fingers hurt under the angled pressure, trying to twist that knob. 'SHHHHHhhhhhh{/si ze}hh.' ~ 'tick.' Good. Now just hold your breath and remain cal-- Oh! Crap! 'Thft thft' The large beast of a man with no shirt, riddled with hellish scars and ridiculously large bulging muscles and a freakishly big long sword, lifts the flimsy cover from over you. With little effort, it? he? tosses the bin aside and it goes flying away into the distance. Why are you looking at the bin or trying to figure out what this thing is!? RUN! With even less effort it lifts its freakishly large sword and swings it down at you. Damn, freezing in place is understandable, that sword is huge and looks like your maker, you close your eyes seeing your inevitable demise. . . . At least it was too dumb to gauge distance, the sword easily pierced the brick wall behind you but was too thick and couldn't finish its journey through to you and through you. It growls loudly, its breath smells of rotten flesh old blood further crippling you. With its monster sized free hand, it reaches to grab you.

Damn it son, focus!! You snap out of it and dodge roll out of the way. Now run! Don't look, just book it! Yes, somethin' is very wrong with this town and place, but trust me, now's not the time to go asking anything or anyone any question's. Hey stop, slow down. You spot a police station up ahead seeing the entire town boarded up on your way here, the lights and sturdy looking metals bars that make up the fence looks like a good bet. You make haste for the large thick, oak, front doors. C'mon try the door. Good, it's open, enter quickly but cautiously. . . . Okay, at first glance, though barely lit by the table lamps scattered throughout, the place looks empty. Not sure if that's good or bad. . . . All right, nice work, your pretty fast when your life depends on it, you just might have a chance at making it out of here. . . You sure ran fast enough, that-big-thing didn't see where you ran off to in that thick fog. Plus you killed like five blocks in a minute and a half. . . . Use the radio it seems to react to those, things? You turn the radio on, nothing, full blast, nothing. . Okay turn it down, remember what happened just a little while ago. I'm pretty sure it heard your feeble attempt to turn off the radio and that's how it found you, otherwise my plan would of worked famously. . . . Fine yeah, how could you know the radio reacts to them and they are attracted to the sound. . . . Well, bam, lesson one. . . . Now your trembling at the entrance to a spooky police station. It looks to have seen some traffic, but not by many and not recently.


I'm a cautious cat so I'm putting both options on the table.

You can turn around and just leave, I mean look at the town and this place, not good. . .

or

On the other hand, this place looks sturdy. You can explore this desolate hellhole and hope to find maybe a map (gonna really need that), maybe some ammo for your peashooter. A nice big policeman flashlight. And heck, there might be answers and some clues as to what the hell is going on in this town.

[[ On your way in the road sign said -Silent Hill-, Never heard of it . . why? What happened here? How'd you end up in the diner and NOT the side of the road with your head cracked open like a busted water melon? Despite all the crap I'm talkin' and the monster and the smoke; When you ponder how you feel about this place, something about it seems strangely familiar . . . You feel like maybe you were summoned here. Almost as if their's an unasked question about it you were called to answer . . . An old 'home' you used to love, but forgot about. In any event as crazy as this sounds, this place feels like its where your supposed to be, like it was a town made for you. . . ]]

Written by Mr. Midnight (54) . A true OG Silent Hill Fan.

Check out the story I'm workin' on called "Invalid Item"
121212.title: Try to sneak around it . . . or something.

12122.content:
You step up to the fell beast which glistens in the strange light from somewhere above. As you lean in close to determine its origins, it begins twitching sporatically!

Without thinking you put another round in (what appears to be) its head! It lies motionless now in a pool of its own black blood.

The monstrosity has the shape of a man but is covered in a horrible "skin" that binds its arms to its chest. It has no discernable facial features as its head too is trapped beneath its cacoon-like flesh.

You shudder when you think about it.
12122.title: The Fallen

choices: Clear a path through the demons!
121221.content:
The beast carries nothing. After turning it over and searching its back, you have wasted enough time to have been ambushed by monsters! The radio begins emitting its static and a distant circle of monsters begin closing in.

Damn. Five bullets--12 monsters.

You frantically look around for an escape route and see a rusted, old, half-destroyed fire escape leaning from the side of a tall brick building.
121221.title: Ambush!

choices: Go inside the building beside you
Stay outside and explore this darkness
1212211.content:
You tuck the revolver in your pocket and climb the old fire escape. It creaks (a lot), and begins to shake.

You frantically try to keep the thing steady, but it's too late. It breaks, and you fall back onto the street.

The beasts are closing in on you, moaning and grumbling ominously. You withdrawl your revolver, cock the hammer, and take aim. Suddenly you hear a strange, loud noise all around you. It resembles a fire siren.

The beasts stop dead, and run off, scared to death of an unseen threat. You're alone, on the sidewalk. It's utterly black outside, and the floor seems to be a grate now.

You light a match, and try to think of what to do now.
1212211.title: The Siren

12122111.content: You immediately enter the building and settle inside. with your match you can see a kind of hall. You can see a door and a stairs.
12122111.title: Go inside the building beside you

121221112.content:
As you walk down the hall you see that the paint has cracked and fallen to the floor. The ceiling has panels fallen from it littering the hallway. As you look up through the holes in the ceiling you can see the wiring that runs to all the rooms on this floor. Making your way further down the hall you come to a set of two doors. One on each side of you. Both of them were at one time painted what appear to be a dark brown but with the painted chipped and the light of your match flickering it makes it hard to see.

Not sure of where the breeze is coming from you can check out the room the room to your right or continue down the hall.
121221112.title: Check the hall first

choices: Check the rest of the room.
1212211121.content:
You push the door inward. You glimpse a candle in a small sconce beside the door. Quickly, as the match is beginning to burn your finger, you light the candle. The small puddle of resulting light reveals an old desk to your right, with bookshelves behind it. The far side of the room is too dark to see.

There's a dank, musty smell in the air. It's obvious that if this room has any windows, they haven't been opened in decades. Almost as if something had read your mind, gentle gust of air flickers the candle flame. You reach up and carefully remove the candle from the sconce.

The radio has begun to buzz again, weakly, but regularly.
1212211121.title: Check Out the Room

12122112.content:
Swallowing down most of your fear and gathering all of your courage, you decide not to go back into the diner. If those monsters ran off, maybe it's safer out here. Maybe...

Keeping the revolver close, you run back to the diner, and decide to head left from it. You turn the corner and walk to another turn, then repeat the same process until you've circled the block. Nothing dangerous at all. But you hear something. It sounds like wings...big wings.

You decide to reenter the diner in hopes that this will just pass over with time. But the diner changed too. The whole place is soaked in blood, and the walls are wreathed with barbed wire. The furniture is missing, save for a stool in the center. The floor is the grate from outside, and the air is unnaturally heavy.

Sitting on the stool (which you don't feel one bit comfortable in due to it's being the ONLY furniture left, and it's in the center) you wait for a half hour. Then you hear it again. The flapping. The ominous beat that eats away at you, haunting you with it's rhythmic curses.

Suddenly a loud burst of static knocks you off your seat. Lucky you: if you hadn't, you'd be dead. A large red figure crashed through the bloody window, and you see it has wings, and large ones at that! Without thinking, survival kicks in and you fire 2 rounds into the devil; one in the chest, one in the stomach. It shakes them off, and howls. You once more fire a round, this time aimed, in the thing's head. The thing falls down, and roars. Then it dies.

Once your heart stops beating at the speed of sound, you try to think of what to do. Then you hear the sound of wings. More wings, a lot more. You don't have enough ammo to fight, but you can't go outside. If this place is like a normal diner, it should have a basement and a kitchen. The kitchen has knives, but there is less chance they'll find you in the basement. But who knows what's down there...
12122112.title: The Red Angel(s)

121221122.content:
"I guess the basement can't be much worse than those devils, but this town is full of surprises." You say to yourself as the wings begin to drive you insane. Cocking your revolver, you head out to find the basement storage.

After a while, you find it. You open the door and stare down into the black. No static from your radio, and you begin to slowly descend the stairs leading down. Suddenly the radio goes crazy, and the noise about makes your ears bleed. Then your hairs stand up, and you hear a bone chilling:

"Welcome"

The door slams shut behind you, and you rush up to it as fast as you can. As you step back to force it open, you hear the breaking of glass all around the diner. Wings all over, screeching echoing around the whole place. Startled, you fall backwards down the stairs. You roll down them loudly, but somehow nothing stirs or anything. You fall for what seems like a painful five minutes before you reach the bottom.

You roll onto your back and moan. You aren't hurt bad, but pretty bruised. You are exhausted. You need sleep or something to drink. You relax your muscles as you feel sleep begin to wash over you. You can't go on much longer. A voice in your head is singing a lullaby. You know this is just the evil of this town. But you can't fight it. What do you do?
121221122.title: Temptation Challenge

choices: Head out on your own like a moron.
1212211222.content:
Striking another match, you begin to navigate the insanely dark hell under the diner. It is just like world above: grates for a floor, barbed wire along the walls, and the feeling that you aren't alone.

Not long after you begin wandering through the endless space of the basement you come to an ominous door. The barbed wire is dripping with fresh blood, and the door handle is a skull, its mouth opened in a desperate screamed. After looking at it, a bullet in the brain seems like a good idea.

Once you summon the courage to open the door, you find something that doesn't quite surprise you. It's a series of corridors, leading to doors with the same decor. You decide not you go through the doors, but rather explore the halls. After ten or so minutes, you reach a large door with a different decoration.

It's a figure that looks like death, scythe and all, holding a large orb. Well, should be holding a large orb. It was a hole where it should be. You marvel at the large mural when footsteps sound from behind you.

You swing around to a "Who the hell are you?" You face a portly balding man, holding a double barrel with a pipe in his belt. He has a duffel bag full of items, and a pocket flashlight placed in his shirt pocket. He pushes past you, and pulls out the orb.

"Umm, I'm (name)." you say, eying the orb.

"Heh, this took a hell of a lot of time to find." he says with a dry chuckle. He places it inside the door, and it immediantly goes *click* with the sound of being unlocked.

"I'm David. Woke up in my van, I did. Came here to investigate a UFO rumor. Same?" he says.

"I woke up in a diner, but I can't remember why I'm here. Or even how I got here. You think the UFO's are behind this?"

"No way, no alien could do this. This is demonic. Probably that damn cult! Oh when I get my hands on them!"

"Cult? What cult?"

"It's nothing to worry about now. I'll tell you later. That is, if you're going my way. Are you?"
1212211222.title: A Person at Last

12122112221.content: Uhhh, I think it be better to stick together. Strength in numbers you know, not to mention that your the first human i've met in this wacko town! David smirked in a reasuring way. I like the way you think kid, glad were on the same page here. He lowers his gun and extends his free hand. You take it in yours and shake, verifiying your new partnership. David turns around and begins to head towards the now open door but stops, turning back around he says. Oh, here, you might just need these. reaching into his bag, he hands you a few boxes of bullets and a sawn off shotgun!!! Wow! Thanks! You say, puting the bullets into your backpack, excluding the ones you used to load up your revolver, and your new shotgun, before slinging said shotgun around your back. No problem, he said, that stuff was just taking up space, and it makes sences to divid up the load. Also, put this in your shirt pocket and turn it on. he says as he hands you a flashlight, much like the one he has. i was planning to save this just in case for when this one burns out. But i think it be wise for both of us to be able to see. Especially if were gonna be walking back to back, just so that way nothing can sneak up on us. Wow, this guy may look and sound like a nut. you think, turning on the flashlight and slipping it into your shirt pocket. But he really does know what he's doing. Now that we're all set here, let get moving. He says as he turns back around and turns the orb, acting as the nob. thus opening the door into the infinate darkness beyond...
12122112221.title: Strength in numbers.

1212212.content:
Deciding that going up may limit your escape routes even more, you cock your revolver and shoot one of the monsters straight in the head. It lets out a gargled scream before falling to the ground. You do the same to the ones on each side of it, the one on the left needing two bullets to come down. You only have one bullet left, but you've managed to make a whole for yourself to escape through.

You take off at a run, listening to the static of the radio as it dies down. You decide that maybe those creatures make the radio go fritzy like that. It will be a good indicator for where you have to go to stay away from them. Because by the looks of things, they aren't friendly.

As you run, you watch the shops and stores pass by you. Abandon cars litter the sides of the streets and the fog makes it hard to see anything that's more than twenty feet in front of you.

How are you supposed to get out of this strange town?
1212212.title: On the Run

choices: Pry at the bars of the hardwood appliance store
121222.content: You leave the deformed corpse behind. Your eyes wide open hoping to get a clearer view of your surroundings only to blink until your eyes stop watering. In your slightly blurred vision you can see a that the buildings end up ahead. The trees line the sidewalk only as a vacant sign of the once vibrant life here. After starring up the street in a mild sleepy stupor, still a bit sleepy, you see a small shape crawl on all fours across the street form the other side. It stops starring mildly back at you: then wanders across into an alley at the end of the buildings. There are apartments across the street and a hardware shop with barred windows and doors at the end of the buildings. You're still curious about the "thing" that you saw earlier. Coming out of your daze you decide...
121222.title: A Fork In the Road

1212221.content: You slowly walk down the deserted street toward where you last saw the creature. carefully trying to make as little noise as possible you glare at the radio which randomly bursts out with interference. soon reaching the end of the row of building, you find the tight dark alleyway you are sure the creature had departed down. If you had a flashlight you could seem much better in the darkness and not walk headlong into trouble...
1212221.title: Light or Dark

12122212.content: Deciding that the hardware store is most likely locked, you bravely enter the dark cramped alley. you stop just inside the darkness waiting for your eyes to adjust. You freeze up as it creeps out from behind a dumpster. Even in the terrible lighting, you can tell this is no normal animal. The smell of blood and rotting flesh assaults your nose, the beast which resembles a dog bounds forward, catching you off guard. it barrels into you at full force, knocking you hard onto the pavement. The fangs filling the skinless face of the dog snap open and shut, inches away from your face. your grip is getting weaker, finding little purchase on the slippery blood soaked musculature of the beastly dog. With a final burst of strength you push the dog off you long enough to scramble to your feet. You breathes comes heavily, and you sweat profusely knowing you only a few scarce seconds to act, before the dog covers the short distance between you....
12122212.title: Dark Depths and Dogs

121222121.content: You pull the revolver from your pocket, and press down the trigger, only to find you had no ammo. The gun only makes a clicking noise, and you remember emptying your gun into the creature you had come across earlier. Then the beast overtakes you, and with a huge burst of pain from your neck, you fade away.

You pull open the door slowly as an uneasyness washes over you. There was no outside, just a long, dark, dirty hallway that twisted about in the dim shadows ahead. "A funhouse..." You say in a vain attempt to calm yourself. "This... this must be one of those... novelty haunted houses or something. No need to worry... I just have to find the exit..." You take a deep breath, make sure your gun is loaded and step into the hallway. It was narrow and very cramped, making it hard to find your way about in the poor lighting. "Jeez, how far does this thing go?" You say nerviously as you duck under a low hanging rusty pipe. After about five minutes the hallway starts to get wider, but just barely. This does nothing to ease your growing paranoia.


Luckily, a large metal door comes into view up ahead and you breathe a soft sigh of relief. "Oh thank god..." You whisper as your pace increases. On the front of the door is what appears to be dried blood and an old worn out envelope with bits of dirt and grime coating it. "Ugh, what is it with this place? They really go the extra mile to creep out their guests." You say as you pick up the envelope and tear it open slowly, careful to not rip the document contained inside. It seemed to be a letter adressed to someone named Blake and a photograph of a little girl and her brother. "Hmm... this is odd. I thought this would be a clue to help me get out of here, but it just looks like an ordinary letter... maybe I should read it though..."

You curse under your breath, but keep the radio with you and put it in your pocket. "It has to work sometime." You thought. Glancing at what left of the kitchen you can see with the lack of light in the other part of the kitchen around a corner you go to step back out of the kitchen.

There are a multitude of reasons why you don't let the man in: you remember the strange hand that had gripped you earlier, you don't know him, you don't feel that you can trust anyone in a place like this, and he didn't seem to realise that the door was unlocked anyway

"LET ME IN! HELP ME..."

You suddenly realise that the man CAN get in. The diner had been destroyed; he could climb over the rubble of the walls, surely?

Suddenly, the man lets out an ear-splitting scream that makes you jump back in shock. You mouth is open - as if you want to say something - but nothing comes out. You don't realise why until a few moments later, where you hear...something in the background. Despite the man's frantic screams, you can hear a low, menacing rumble. It could be growling, but you know that the source of that noise is something horrible.

The rumbling gets louder; the man's screams become more frantic and the banging on the door intensifies. You are paralysed; what if that thing could get in? What will it do to the man outside - for now you believe that he can be trusted. However, you don't dare open the door now for fear of letting that thing in with him!

You could check the window to see what is following him, but you don't think you want to see what it is.

You exhale in one long, ratting breath, becoming aware for the first time how much you're shaking. In fact, you're so nervous that when you feel a bulge in the pocket of your shirt, you flinch.

15222212112221212121112211112.content:
Urged on by the whispering static crackle of the radio, Aaron volunteers to scout nearby for a boat ride out of the bushes you were hiding in. He was gone two minutes before returning breathless and excited.
"Found one! Pretty dirty, but we've dealt with more horrid things." Aaron announced with a hint of triumph. "It's this way." He waved in the direction he came from.

Unfortunately, the static grew louder as they approached the boat, half dragged onto the sand-crested lake shore. The three of you approach cautiously, weapons at the ready, with images of the nurses and the blob still fresh in memory. Just a few feet away from the decrepit but messianic boat, the static on the radio seemed to be forming audible words. Jenny was the first to notice, and with a halting motion of her hand and a tilt of her head told both you and Aaron to listen more closely. You did, and what you heard sent chills down your spine.

"...Hel... Heeeelppp.... Sss-ssaaave..." The words were clear between bursts of static. Your mind raced to rationalize how most electronic voice phenomena were mere random sounds interpreted to be more by over-enthusiastic paranormal whackos. But this was no EVP. This was hair-raising and genuine. The three of you listened to a few more weak pleas of help and deliverance before the static reigned unchallenged again. But another sound replaced the words. The sound of something wet half-shuffling, half-dragging on the sand. You saw it first.

Emerging from the water as its trail indicated, the creature was now close enough to reach out with a deformed hand and cling onto the other end of the boat. You manage a muffled sound of alarm that caught Aaron and Jenny's attention. Jolted from their thoughts regarding the earlier pleas, they were just as shocked to see the creature, draped in what seemed to be a brown, tattered cloak wet with lake water, was just a few feet away. Aaron moved forward protectively, while Jenny raised her gun to bear, minding the few bullets left in it.
"Holy shit! What is that?" Aaron exclaimed as he cautiously placed himself between the creature and you and Jenny.
"Okay.... Okay..... Ahm, guys, what do we do??" Jenny was frantic for a course of action that would spare their lives and save bullets in the process.

The creature stood like a man would, slightly hunched, and the cloak, though ragged, hid most of its probably grotesque features, as the three surmise from seeing part of its hidden face. One eye socket was missing the eyeball, and the gaping hole was large enough to allow sufficient light to reflect the slimy surface of whatever is inside its head. The other eye was yellowish with wisps of white, and completely unfocused. The nose was virtually gone, decayed or eaten away, and the nasal cavity could easily be seen. The mouth was slightly open in what would amount to an agonizing grimace, showing blackened, putrid, crooked teeth in gaps, held by decaying gums bleeding pus. The lips were almost green, as was the rest of the creature's complexion as can be seen through the tears on its cloak. The hand gripping the other end of the boat was lacking all five fingernails, and a couple of fingers were twisted to an obscene angle. The figure seemed to be breathing, as the sounds of labored breathing and a husky voice were heard in time with the up and down movement of its lurched back. Though the creature had no tongue, the words that came from it turned the trio's blood cold:
"...H-hhe...heeeelp.....meeeee..."
A split second after each sound from the creature, the radio static gave way to similar sounds, which made the ghoulish plea all the more unnerving. The creature was pleading for them to save it, and its pleas echoed through the radio.

153.content:
"I'm the only person left alive in this godforsaken town," she replies. "My name is Jenny. I own this diner, or what's left of it. I don't really know what happened. I woke up a couple mornings ago and everyone was gone. The whole town has changed. I tried to get out, but all the roads out of town are blocked. I don't know what to do. There are strange creatures everywhere."

"Where am I?" You ask as you try to sit, however, a terrible headache strikes you and you grab your head. Maybe it's best to just lay down for a while. "This place is called Silent Hill. And believe me, it's silent allready. The only sound you will hear will be the creatures outside or the wind and rain." Your still a bit confused. How did you get here? And what are those creatures she talks about? Maybe it's better to ask before you one of them... "What are those creatures you are talking about?", you ask. Jenny gives you a concerned look. "I don't know, hon. I lived on my own in this damned place for at least half a year now but I can't figure it out. You only see them at night and only their shadows or their eyes. They never actually ventured into the village at day, but at night, you want to keep your doors closed. One time, on a rainy night, I forgot to bring in the laundry and I went outside. Only 2 steps after i left the diner, I felt eyes poking in my backside. I turned and saw two pair of sparkling red eyes in the distance close to that building over there." She points to a building about 40 metres away from the diner. The place seems very ghastly indeed, but maybe it won't be that bad in daylight. The night changes many things. Still, an uncomfortable feeling grabs you and won't let go. "Are you sure it were eyes?", you stammer. "I mean, red sparkling eyes, that's just not possible, i think you saw something else." Jenny laughed at you. "You think my eyes are that bad? I can reconize eyes when they look at me! And they moved too! After I saw them, they disappeared behind the building. But they came back I tell ya. Only 2 weeks later, I saw a pair of those eyes through the window! Whatever it was, it was closer than 10 metres away from me! And it was very big and had four legs. It howled at me! It was only a short moment, but I allmost wet myself when I saw them, I swear to god! That was 1 week ago. But since then, i've been carrying that old shotgun. Seriously, if I can get out of here, I won't waste the opportunity." You watch the old shotgun that lies down at the table and then you watch out of the window in disbelief. Is she making all of this up or is it true. She must be mad or something, cause you know very well, "monsters don't exist". You are about to turn away from the window when you see them. A pair of sparkling red eyes, coming from the building where Jenny saw them the first time! Apart from the eyes, you see a big shadow in the darkness and you can make up four legs out of it. It's much bigger than a wolf, or most other fourlegged creatures you know that look like a wolf. Just when you are about to scream, you see the glance of the eyes fade away and the shadow dissapear behind the building. "What the hell was that!", is the only thing you can get out of your mouth.

You really start to get a white face now. "C-curse?" You don't have a reputation for being a coward or anything, but this is just TO freakin weird. Somehow you still expect to wake up or something like that. "Yes, it's a long story and I don't want to scare you anymore than you allready are. At least, it's not something you talk about at night in this eerie place." Jenny looks concerned and checks the door just to be sure. "It's just a suitcase, I mean cm'on.", You think. And you also can't remember how you got here and you only know what is inside if you check it out. It's a very big and suitcase with two silver locks on it. A golden coloured Christian cross on the sides but has a dark pentagram on the back side and the front. You open the suitcase, carefully and take a look inside. Jenny is starting to get curious watches over your shoulder. You first see some basic stuff you put in those suitcases like you went on a businesstrip. Some old cloths of yours, your toothbrush and two towels are the first things you find. Suddenly you feel something hard beneath one of the towels. It feels hard and cold and you quickly try to grab it for examination. You look puzzled when you suddenly draw an old but expensive looking copper cross out of the suitcase. "Wow, how did you get that?" Jenny certainly didn't expect that from you. You wonder what else would be in the suitcase. At least you never knew you had something like that. Curious what else will be in, you start to dig again. You find a gun! It's polished, not very heavy but most importantly, it's empty. You were so shocked that you dropped the gun on the carpet. You never had a gun as far as you knew! In fact, you hate guns and all sorts of violence. Seeing the expressions on your face, Jenny starts to feel uncomfortable too. "Are you sure this is your suitcase?" "Ye-yes, i'm sure, look, those old cloths are mine, so is this toothbrush, but I don't know about the rest..." "Well, I know for sure the suitcase wasn't here before you arrived, suddenly..." You regain yourself and you check if you at least can find any ammo for the gun. Maybe you need it with those freak things outside. Those red sparkling eyes really freeze you to the bone if you think about them. Once again, you search through the suitcase but you can't find any ammo. You do find, however, a necklace of garlic, a wooden stalk with a very sharp point and a dagger with a dark creature with wings on it. Both of you don't know what to say but you both sure feel uncomfortable...

153111.content: Jenny finally finds the courage to speak again. Outside, the rain is continuing to fall. It's allmost dawn, but the sky is still black and far, far away you can hear the howling of wolfs or maybe something bigger and deadlier. "I don't know. The first thing I remember is that I woke up here in the diner." Jenny looks at you like she doesn't believe you. And it actually does make sense that she doesn't believe you, you think. "And you expect ME to believe that? Just think about it. I live here, 5 months on my own after the rest of the village dissapeared into nothingness and 2 weeks after those...Things... Show up, you appear out of nothing with an even stranger suitcase which you don't reconize.." Jenny suddenly grabs her shotgun and points it at you! "How should I know YOU are not 1 of THEM huh?" You didn't expect that and you walk frightently backwards. "Hey, hey, I'm as much in dark about this as you!" "Yeah right, in the dark huh, well, prove me your not a monster, coming to finish the job." With that, she points the shotgun to your nose. Unbelievably frightened, you can get "Well if i WAS a monster, then wouldn't I have killed you allready?" out. To your relief, she lowers the shotgun, but she still isn't sure. You don't only see doubt in those beautiful eyes of hers, but also fear. You found enough courage to speak again. "Come on now, if we want something, we can better do it together instead of threatening or killing eachother off." "Yes, yes your probably right." She sighs relieved and puts the shotgun back on the table. "I'm sorry I scared you, this must be hard for you too, IF what you say is true." "It is, it is." You say before she suspects you of something vile again. "It's ok, it must be hard for you too, living here all on your own in fear." She vaguely smiles at you. "Thanks for forgiving me, living on your own under those conditions is hard indeed. Friends?" You agree. "Friends. Jenny sighs relieved again and walks to the window for 1 last check. "I have a few spare blankets, you can make those your bed. I think it would be best to get some shuteye first, before we do anything else again." Suddenly you feel very tired and feel the urge to lie down again. "Good idea, maybe we can find out tomorrow what that thing was." "Don't count on it, the rain, probably washed any signs away and I couldn't find any clue the last 2 times. But let's sleep first, I don't think those things will come back today, it's past 5 allready. Tomorrow I will also tell you about the curse." You watch the black sky while rain keeps pouring down. "If there will ever be a dawn again at least." You turn around, but you see that Jenny allready fell asleep. You follow her example, but allthough you are tired, it will take you at least 30 minutes to get to sleep. The last thing you can remember is that you hear the howling of the wolves, before you lose consciousness...
