1531112.content: It won't be the sound of the continuing rain that woke you up. You hear something scratching against glass in your sleep. Suddenly realising what it could be, you wake up! Still half asleep you examine your surroundings, but your eyes feel drawn to the window on the northside where you saw that thing the first time. Suddenly, you see a very big hairy paw with long nails scratching against the window! You wrap yourself tightly in blanket and you start to feel really frightened. What will happen if the glass breaks? Will something with very big claws and red shiny eyes storm in and kill you two painfully? You quickly look at Jenny, but she's fast asleep, oblivious for all that is happening. You stare again at the window, but the big claw is gone! Still you know you aren't making things up, since you can still make out the scratches, the beast left on the glass. A few deep carvings with sometimes a red liquid is left on northern window, probably blood! But at least the claw is gone. Then it happens! A pair of Shiny red ruby eyes gaze through the window and look straight at you! You feel like a living statue, unable to move while fear has mastered you. You can read pure evil in those eyes and the desire to kill you. Behind the eyes you can make out a very big shadow, a black hole in the darkness. It's probably just too dark to be precise, but the only thing you can make out of it, is part of the face. Whatever it is, it has a long snout, it's hairy, has pointy ears, but that's only part of the face you can see. The rest is a super massive black hole and will remain unknown for the time. The time might not be too far off to see the beast from a closer angle you fear. You can finally take your eyes of the beast and you look to Jenny. Surely she must be awake after that terrible howl. To your surprise, she is still sleeping! Your totally on your own now. The red eyes still look at you and you feel like walking to the door, open it and to go outside. You are shocked after you learned of this new and surely deadly desire. The beast is hypnotising you! You must fight it, or your life is forfeit! You close your eyes and slowly turn away and grabbing the nearest object in the proces. Is it still there? Yes, the evil eyes are still there, but something has changed. The evil aura and desire to kill is still there, but something new can be read in the eyes. Doubt. Suddenly, the thing's eyes extinguishe and leave the scene. The claw makes 1 more bloody scratch on the window, and then it dissappeared like it came. Still unbelievably frightened, you force yourself to stay awake. IT might come back anytime and it's still not looking like it's gonna be day soon! However, sleep is taking you over and with the easing sound of the falling rain, you finally drift asleep again...

As sunlight meets your face, you can't help but smile. Waking up on a nice day, allways is a good start for you. It's actually hard to believe that there really is something out there, trying to kill them. The rain however left it's traces. The ground was covered in mud. The only thing that has concrete in this little town was the 1 way that seems to lead out of the village. You see the building where you saw the monster the first time. It was actually just an abandoned old bar. Wind and rain ruined it further. There's a small row of other wooden houses next to it, all in a ragged shape. Next to you there's the postoffice and the store. While the one end of the road leads to the exit of the village, the other end leads to an old church. It's rather big for such a small community. It's bell tower reflects the sunlight and shines proudly on the horizon. Again you are surprised that such a peacefull scenery looks so different at night. Behind the buildings you can see a sea of trees and behind the trees, mountains with high white peaks rise up on the horizon. It allmost looks like they form a ring around the forest and the village. You can also see a big roof with a big chimney rise above the forest. Somewhere out there are things trying to kill you, waiting for dark and a new opportunity. "Where is that road leading to? You said that there was no way out of this village." Jenny looks surprised at you. "If I COULD get out, I would have done that. Unfortunatly, it's not possible anymore. About a year ago, an earthquake caused the mountainpass to collapse and it's blocked by debris and big rocks now. Finding a new path over the mountains could maybe take a week! You expect me try and sleep outside with those things on my tail?" You turn away again and look through the window. Hope leaves you for a moment and you felt that maybe you will never leave this village alive. You are curious about that other thing in the woods though. If that's a house, there might be other people. Maybe they no something usefull. It seems that Jenny guessed what you were thinking and shook her head. "That's the old mansion in the forest. Some noble used to live there, but it's empty now, just like the rest of the village. "Can you tell me about the curse now?" You suddenly feel the urge to talk about it again." Jenny puts on her furcoat and a pair of boots. "Come on then." You look puzzled, but follow her example. "What are we going to do?" "We need to go to the big church over there, I left the book of curse there. There's a small library in the church and that's where I found it the first time. It saves me time to explain if we can get our hands on that book." She grabs her shotgun of the table and opens the 3 locks on the door. "I rather take this babe with me now those monsters appear more often." You again, follow her example and take the dagger with the strange creature on it. You wonder what it is, but it's a no use pondering about it now. "You can also bring the gun with you. I'm sure the store has some bullets left for you, now come on, or do you want to wait till it get's dark?" You hurry up and take both weapons. After you both left and locked the door of the diner, you 2 make your way to the church.

1531112221111.content: In a trance, you close the book and look at Jenny. "You knew all of this?" She nods. "But there is more! Come with me." She walks into the room where she just came from. You walk into a dark and dusty room with only 1 small window, high on the back wall. There's another carpet on the floor, smaller though than in the main chamber of the church, but with the same design. She shows you another book, but there's a lock on the book this time. In a reflex, you grab the key, but it doesn't fit. "Useless dear, I tried that the first time I saw the books. But what seems strange to you?" You watch the two books and start to compare them. "!!!" You suddenly got it. The book that you just had read, said "Book of Curse I" and the other book said "Book of Curse III". "Where is part II? How many books are there?" "I don't know how many parts there are, but I DO know that we are missing at least 1 part and a key. Maybe the key we need is in book II." You are still trying to find out what you need the key for. "Maybe we need this key for book II?" "Possible, but there's something else that I want to show you." On the darkest corner of the small library, there's a stone statue in the form of an imp. It has a dagger in it's throat and his face expresses the agony it must have been undergoing. In the mouth however, there's a hole." Jenny suddenly takes they key out of your pocket and put's it in the imp's mouth. It fits!! But... Nothing happened. You thought you heard something click, but very faintly and not coming from the wall you are facing, but somewhere else in the room. "I checked the keyhole some time ago and the meaning IS that you turn the key, but you can't turn it anyway. We probably need another key for it, but it should be one like this one." You start to think. That is a lot of new information coming your way and a lot of new riddles to solve. "How about the other room?" you ask. You start to get curious about that one. Jenny however can't tell you anything usefull about it. "I've never been there, the door is locked and the big lock on the door is very strong. It's possible that we can use this key over there, but it's impossible to enter that room without the key." You both look around. You suddenly became aware of a change in your surroundings. It's a change in the room, but caused by elements outside. The light that shines through the small window is getting weaker and weaker. Clouds are gathering from the east and it seems mist is also rolling in from the north. You touch Jenny on the shoulder, who is still thinking about the possibilties. You two have more pressing things to take care of however. "Jenny, I think we need to hurry back, it's getting dark again!" It seemed like Jenny suddenly awoke from her dreamworld and realised you were right. "O god, we've allready spend too much time here! Let's get back quickly before it's dark. The mist can't be a good sign either. We don't want to be out here if those beasts appear again!" Both of you quickly turn around and walk out of the church. You suddenly remember something. "Can we pay the store a quick visit? I want something more than an empty gun and a small dagger to defend myself with." "Sure, but we need to hurry. Being outside is not recommendable after the sun has gone down. As you walk out, you see the sun dissappear behind the mountains and the clouds packing together again.

15311122211111.content: You both hurry along the old road in the village, making your way through fog that starts to grow thicker every minute. You finally make it to the general store and you open the door. It smells terrible in here. Many products started to rot and the odor is overwhelming. Jenny closes the door behind you and tells you to hurry. She's keeps standing close to the door, peeking in the coming darkness while readying her shotgun, in the hope NOT to see any red sparkling eyes. So far, the coast is clear, but there no need to push your luck. "Hurry up! They have patrons at the back of the store." As you get there, you have no idea which ones to take! As you start doubting which ones to take, panic slips into you. Putting the wrong bullets in the gun might be fatal! Which ones will you take?! "What's the hold up allready?" Seems like Jenny grows impatient and ofcourse, she too must feel uncomfortable. These doors don't have locks anymore and some windows are broken. If those monstrosites come over here, they will surely be able to enter the store. "I-I don't know which ones to take!" "Just take as many as you can, we'll figure out which ones to use later, but please, hurry up!" Panic can be heard in her voice. You quickly grab as many patrons you can and stuff your pockets with them. You run back to Jenny and make an excuse to Jenny. Outside, the rain has started to fall and the last of the daylight has disappeared. "Let's go." Jenny opened the door and took a last look. Just as you were about to leave you heard howling. The same howling as yesterday and it sounds awfully close. Still, no red eyes visible, so maybe they are just wandering around the forest. Both of you however, make a run to the diner. Another howl, this time even closer! Both of you start to panic and look at the direction where it came from. Still nothing visible except for more fog, but it's coming your way, no doubt! Only a few more meters. She tosses you the key of the diner and turns around, aiming her shotgun at fog till now. The key is a bit rusted, so you can't get the door open right away. "Hurry up!!!" "I'm busy!!!" Both of you are panicking now. Another howl and this time, a faint red glow is visible through the fog. The eyes are on the same height as Jenny's and she starts to scream. You finally get the door open and you yell Jenny to come inside. Instead, she fires at the forthcoming eyes with the shotgun. A heavy growl and for a second the eyes dim a little. However, after the that, the eyes shine even brighter than before and the creature starts to dash forward. It seems like Jenny is paralised or something cause she's nailed to the ground. You quickly pull her inside by her wrist and close the door. Jenny recovered quickly and helps you to put the locks on the door. Just when you put the last lock on the door, something very heavy crashes into the door! It's just a wooden door and for a moment, you fear that the door might break by the attack. Fortunatly, the door holds allthough all of the metal locks made a clear clinging sound. Next to you, Jenny starts to panic again. "O my god, it's gonna ram the door open!" You however, grab the copper cross and load your gun. But for now, it seems it wasn't necessary. One more heartrending howl and then...Nothing... You finally find the courage to peek through the window, but there's nothing to see anymore. The fog is gone by now, but the rain started to pour again...

"Yes, thanks by the way." She looks grateful to you and she smiles. She's very cute actually, but you have more pressing subjects on your mind. "Are-are those things those demons that mother was talking about?" Jenny sighs and makes a tired impression. "I believe so, but that still doesn't tell us, how to get rid of it. At least I don't know for sure.. At least things would make a little more sense now." Your face grows pale, this might be too much for you. "Th-that means there are 7 of those freaks outside?" "Maybe, at least we know now those things are demons." A lot of things got cleared up now. "And those demons were the 7 murdered children first before they got burned on a cross and taken over by demons? How do we defeat those?" Jenny walked to the window and looked outside. "i've been thinking about that too, but I think we need to read the other 2 books first before we can do anything useful at all." "That would make sense indeed, but... Where are those 2 books? We know that book I and III are in the library, but where is book II?" Then Jenny suddenly turned to you and said something you didn't expect. "I have a hunch! I think I know where it is." This could be interesting. For a moment you forget the demons outside and you wonder how she would know. "Where is the second book then?" "In the big mansion in the forest." You expected a lot, but not that. "Why there?" "That's another story, but i'm sure it has to do with the curse." "Can you tell me?" "I guess it can't hurt to tell you. After all, we're in the same shit together now. It's a long story, but it tells about the mother, her children and the noble of the mansion." 1531112221111121.content:
Alison Jones was a lucky woman that lived in the village of Silent Hill. She was 25 years old, she looked very beautiful and she gave birth to 7 children in total. She had a happy marriage, enough money to make a nice living and to travel which she allways loved to do. One day however, all of that was gonna change. Her husband was struck by a decease and no docter in the whole area could help him. A message came from another village over the mountainpass, saying that a witch escaped their clutches. A woman, fitting her description would have poisoned the mayor there and the mayor died after 7 days of agony and pain. Rumors spread quickly and soon enough, there was an angry mob in front of her house, calling her a witch. Her husband died in the meantime and his last words were "Alison!!!". The people of Silent Hill thought that was meant as an accusation and she and her children were arrested. After an unfair trial, all 8 of them were sentenced to death by a funeral pyre. However, the mother managed to escape and disappeared in the woods. The only thing she had on her mind was saving her children, but when she came back to the village, the last of her seven children was tossed into the fire while bound to a wooden cross. She heard "Mommy!!!!" and after, no more. She fled away from the village, doing nothing else than crying and crying and she passed out on the forest way.

However, there was a noble living in a mansion. He build it there because he wanted to have no business with the rest of the population of Silent Hill. Barbarian savages, that's was his opinion of the people of Silent Hill. He lived there with his wife minding his own business. He had only 1 child, a boy of 7 years old. Until 1 day, when he found a young woman near the side of the road. Allthough he didn't like the people of Silent Hill, he was a good man and couldn't leave a helpless woman here to die. He took her with her and that turned out to be a very big mistake. After she came by, the only thing she did was crying, the first week. His wife demanded she left the house, she was disturbing the peace. The old noble however, couldn't help but to feel pity for her and refused to kick her out. She got her own room in the big mansion and was supposed to live in harmony with the rest of the family. However, the woman started to act more and more strange every day. She started to draw pentagrams and to mutter to herself. She gave herself scars and started to curse the people of Silent Hill. The people of Silent Hill didn't forget about the supposed witch and after a big part of their animals died, they resumed the chase and sooner or later, they arrived at the mansion. In the meanwhile, Alison started to worship the devil and started to write. Two of the results are "the book of curse I and III". It seems that the little son of the noble also died, struck by a black decease. The wife of the noble begged to kick her out of the house, but he simple couldn't. She was the "only child he had left". While searching the mansion, Alison was found, arrested along with the rest of the family that still lived. The books were also found and brought to the church as proof. Both the noble and his wife got stoned to death and Alison was tossed into another funeral pyre. In her last moments, she spoke a curse over the the population of Silent Hill and then she was gone... Still, the story of Alison Jones became a local legend and it seems the curse found his effect...

Jenny finally stopped talking. There was a sudden silence in the room. Outside, lightning struck the earth, but in the diner, it was all quiet. "So, that means that Alison wrote what i read this afternoon and that she placed this curse upon Silent Hill and the world." "It seems that way indeed. But that also means that the second book can be at the mansion." You look uncertain, cause you don't know for sure. And it still means you have to make a dangerous journey to the mansion, just for a book actually. "Are you sure it's there?" Jenny stood up and looked at you. "Nope, I don't know for sure, but I looked everywhere I could in the village. The most logical place would be the mansion and we NEED that second book!" You sigh and stand up too. "I guess you are right." You wanted to prepare for bed. You probably need some rest if you two are going to the mansion tomorrow. However, outside the monotonous sound of rain is no longer only disturbed by the sound of thunder. Many howls are in the air and they are close! About as close when you fled back here from the store. You both run to the window on the northside and to your dismay, you see many pairs of red ruby eyes light the darkness!! Another howl and another. It seems the demons aren't waiting for tomorrow...
1531112221111121.title: The life of Alison

15311122211111211.content: You follow your instinct and quickly step away from the window. There's a lightbulb attached to the ceiling that only gives a little light. It's enough however to light the head of the demon that ventured to the window and you can finally see what has been hunting you two. Apart from the long snout, hairy face and red sparkling eyes, you can see it's mouth for the first time. Big fangs, several rows of teeth like a shark and blood red tongue. The rest of it, is still darker than the night itself. The eyes peer inside and they are staring at you again. This time, your can master your instincts and point your gun at the window. You hold the cross in your left hand and the gun in the right hand and you feel confident somehow. It's just like the last time! Doubt can be read in the eyes of the monster again, but this time, they don't go away! They point their gaze at Jenny instead that doesn't have a proper answer. She starts trembling all over but can't bring out a word. She does reawake though when you take aim at the head. "Stop!!!" She's too late however and you allready pulled the trigger. *click* Nothing! "Are you out of your mind, even my shotgun didn't stop it, you think a single bullet will take it down? You will only break the glass and allow them in!!" "You are right, i'm sorry." you answer. You were right in the store after all. The "wrong bullet" could have been fatal after all! Good you picked wrong one, otherwise you would have at least 3 demons sharing the same room with you and Jenny. The closed demon howls at you two but doesn't seem to attack..yet. You were at least partly right! The cross makes them doubt, which is good to know. Still, you don't want to be outside with only holding a cross and a good as empty gun. Suddenly, the rain stops falling from the sky and the moon becomes visible. The three demons you can see growl, but are leaving in a hurry. Whatever their plan was, it went wrong. Still, the night was still young and what if they come back again later? You can hear them howl again, they are probably still around. Now what? You can't go outside, you don't know how to defeat them and you probably can't fight off determined attack. That wooden door allready got a nasty beating after one dash. Suddenly you realised your only option. You two need to leave this diner if you want to survive! As soon as possible, but where to? All the buildings here are in a poor state and made of wood. Maybe this would be the most relative safe place to be for now. Except for the church, which is made of stone. There's only one way in, but maybe they found a way to get in or something. It is a church with pentagrams and all and where you found the books of curse. You will think twice before fleeing there. And besides, if those demons are close, they will certainly see us! And the distance is too big to risk a run for the church. You have to hold out till tomorrow and then make your journey to the mansion. The village of Silent Hill can't protect you 2 anymore. You take a look around and watch the diner one more time. Enough furniture and the floor is made of strong looking wood. "Jenny! Let's grab the furniture and barricade the door and windows as best as we can." She seemed surprised but she starts doing it. "What are you planning and on what do you plan to sit on from now on?" It might sound like you grabbed command, but you are sure this is the only way to survive. "My plan is that we defend ourselves as good as possible till it get's light and then we move to the mansion in the forest." "But, but." "I know, I know, it doesn't sound perfect and it's still risky, but this place is not safe enough anylonger. Let's be gratefull if we see dawn again." You grimmly start working on the barricade. No way in hell you will end up on some Altar of Sacrifice...

You and Jenny check the barricades a last time. You allmost used everything you could find in the diner, even your black suitcase after you got everything out. You two moved the bed in front of the door, the big closet of Jenny against the room and everything else behind it. There is only a small stroke of window you can look through, but it's enough. You made sure you had the right kind of ammo in your gun by testing it on the floor. Not that it matters, firepower won't save the day, or actually night, this time. You both also prepared a backpack for tomorrow so you two can start your journey to the mansion early. Jenny told you that the road at least takes you 6 hours walking. And maybe you two are forced to take a detour and you want to make sure you arrived before dark. Armed with the necklace of garlic (hey, you never know when it will come in handy), the strange dagger, the gun and the cross, you prepared yourself as best as you can. Next to you, Jenny found a knife she used to cut meat with. She also assembled all of her shotgun ammo and tries not to look scared. Outside, no sound was heard yet, it only started to drizzle a bit. You walk over to Jenny. She seems exhausted but also scared. "Hey Jenny." You gently put an arm around her shoulder. It doesn't seem she minds, instead, she looks at you tenderly. "Why don't you get some sleep, you look like you can fall over any minute." "Thanks." She says. "I hate to admit it, but I really can use some sleep right now. But only if you promise me to wake me up in an hour. Then YOU need some sleep mister." You laugh at eachother. "You know, whatever happens tonight, you were a good friend." "So are you Jenny, now get some sleep. Whatever will happen, you will need it." After an hour and 15 minutes, you wake her up and tell her to wake you up after an hour or if she even suspects there's something near. You look at your watch. It's 2.03 now. The floor is hard, but eventually you fall asleep.

As you wake up again, it's 5.25!!! As you look around you in panic, you see Jenny sleeping next to you to your relief. You gently wake her up. When you wake her, she suddenly jumps up and realised the danger they escaped! "I'm so sorry, I-I just could keep my eyes open and..." You try to comfort her, these are rough times for a girl like her too. "It's ok Jenny, at least we both got some sleep and it we still live. Let's just see it as a warning for next time." She sighs and thanks you again. Outside it started to rain harder again. This got you on your toes again, since that means that the chance those demons come back have seriously increased. You have a feeling, it's not over yet for tonight...

1531112221111121121.content: Jenny suddenly wakes you up and not a minute to early. You can allready hear the howling near the diner and you prepare to defend yourself. One last check on your watch. 7.27! And it won't be day for at least another hour! The clouds make the sky even darker than it allready was and meanwhile, the ground has been turned to a mudpile again. You walk up to the barricade of the window and take a quick look outside. You see 3 pair of red shiny ruby eyes this time, but maybe there are more of them. This time, their eyes shine even brighter than usual. It seems like the demons are planning to end it today! You quickly check the barricade one last time and then you prepare for battle. A fell heartrending howl is heard and it seems like the sign to attack. A few seconds later, you hear a loud crash on the wooden door, but it has been reinforced this time. Strengthend by the bed and some other furniture, the door holds. No need to use the weapons till now. You carefully walk to the window, only to see 2 of the shadows, both focussed on the door. Suddenly you smell an awful sulfur odor. You turn around a bit, only to look into the eyes of the 3th demon and suddenly it tries to snap at you! You quickly pull away in a reflex and your butt hits the ground. You can still see the eyes through the window and then they disappear for a moment. You stand up and at the same time, there's a crashing sound heard. The 3th demon tries to force it's way through the window this time. The glass with the carvings shatters, but the barricade holds. Another loud crash can be heard, but the door holds again. Your plan worked till now! If one of them get's in, it's game over for you two and you know it! another howl. There's a lot of anger in it this time and grab your gun and some reserve ammo. The window is broken anyway, so you can at least fire back. Sometimes you or Jenny fires a shot at one of the forthstorming demons and each time, the barricades hold them off or they pauze their bash when they get hit. Still, no sign of serious injury is shown and it doesn't look like they get tired or give up. This time, they are determined to finish you 2 off for good! Suddenly you get suspicious of something. They only need 2, 1 for the door and 1 for the window. What is that 3th beast doing? You take a step backward when a drop of water hits you from the ceiling. Apparantly, you just moved under a leak spot. Suddenly you point your gun at the roof. Ofcourse! If they can't force their way in by breaking the door or the window barricade, they try something else. The other walls are in reasonable state and the floor is made of a thick layer of wood, but the roof is as leak as a basket! You gesture Jenny to be quiet and point to the roof. Sometimes the silence is broken by a crash in the door or barricade but to no avail. Then you hear it. Paws on the roof! You don't hesitate and fire at the roof where you think it came from. After 2 shots, you hear a growl and a slipping sound and then a splash. It seemed you hit the demon and it fell of the roof. A raged howl can be heard but the attackers don't plan to quit yet! Jenny stands next to the barricade on and fires shotgun shell after shell. You watch the roof and if you hear something, you shoot in that direction till you hear another growl. There seems no stopping them, but wave after wave, the 2 defenders hold their ground. Suddenly the attacks stop and after one last raged, but tired howl, they attackers leave the scenery. You look outside and see that the rain has lessened too. Jenny sits down and wipes the sweat of her forehead. "I really thought we would die tonight." "Not yet, but at least i'm not planning to stay here any longer than necessary. At daybreak, we must leave immediatly. You both check the barricades. Allthough they both lasted, it looked like they both couldn't take much more. It will be make or break time tomorrow...

15311122211111211211.content: As the sun peeks over the mountain tops, you both wake up. It seemed wise to get some sleep before leaving for the mansion. Who knows when you get the opportunity to sleep again... You gently wake Jenny up and you grab your bag and your weapons. The ammo you took with you yesterday is gone. You check your gun, only 3 bullets left. Luck hasn't left you two yet. On the advice of Jenny, you pay the store another visit and this time, you know exactly what ammo to take. You both also take a flashlight with you and a few spare batteries and a pair of extra cloths. As you both stand outside again, the sun has risen on the east. The clouds are gone and the temperature has risen too. It feels really nice to be outside today, allthough the ground is still soaked. After a quick breakfast, you two get on your way. It's a few minutes past 10 when you reach the outskirts of the forest. You start to follow the road but Jenny suddenly stops. "Wait, will it be safe to follow the road?" You stop to think about that. You entirely forgot that last night! Maybe they won't attack you at light, but they can still follow you! There's plenty of dark places in the forest anyway. But you don't want to risk to go offroad too far. Maybe those demons dare to attack you in the darker parts of the forest and if you get lost and don't reach the mansion before dark, you two are screwed! After a short discussion, you 2 found an agreement. You will walk through the bushes and the forest, but keep the road in sight. As you two follow your way through the forest, nothing seems unusual. Jenny and you even dare to talk a bit and you 2 get to know eachother a little better. Suddenly you come across a crossing. The forestway resumes his way forward, but a mudpath crosses it. It seems the left path leads to the mountains but the path to the right deeper into the forest. It looks awfully dark down there and if you examine the ground quickly, you see massive clawprints in the mud! These clawprints must have been fresh, otherwise the rain would have washed it away. The only strange thing is, there are some way smaller prints next to it. It looks like footprints, but that seems impossible since Jenny was the only person living here for months. Still, this new discovery unsettles you and Jenny. Since you can't go back to Silent Hill, the only option is to press onward but quietly and more carefull than before. The forest seems more hostile too. The birds have stopped singing and the bugs have gone silent too. The only sound that can be heard in miles are your foots. You look at your watch. It's a bit past 1 and the sun shines high in the sky. If it was dark, you would probably have been dead by now. You both feel you need to hurry up a bit. It might get dark early today...

In the middle, stones are placed and together they form a circle. "This is where we used to picknick sometimes. This place brings back a lot of memories." Jenny is about to walk enter the grass circle when you pull her back. Somehow, you don't trust it allthough it's still sunny. "Wait, it's just too quiet around here..." "Ohh, nonsence, nothings gon.." She interups her scentence as she sees fog rolling in from the other side of the field. It's slowly coming towards you but it's still only on the other side of the circle behind the trees. Ofcourse, you both don't trust this sudden fog and unease and fright come back at you. Now what?! Jenny suddenly pulls your arm and pulls you with her. "Your lucky I played a lot of hide and seek around here." she whispers. She pulls you behind a collection of trees and bushes and starts looking for something. Apparantly, she found it. She dives into the bushes and whispers you to follow. You fear that, if you open your eyes, that you look straight into the red eyes of a demon, ready to kill you. It seems it sniffs a bit around the position you and Jenny were standing a minute ago. Then it's head rears up and looks to all directions. It seems not to know where you are. yet... Another howl can be heard from direction you came from. The village. It's far, far away, and you guess that came from 1, near the village. Except for the the big mansion, there's a smaller building next to it, but not connected directly to the mansion. You can also see a stone well and a few stone statues. You look to find a way to get over the fence. It's rather high and looks sturdy and has spikes on top. Not a bad point, since those demons can't climb it, but how do you get to the other side? You knew you should have brought a rope... Jenny calls your name, she found a way in maybe. There's a big hole in the fence where she is standing. It doesn't look like those demons did that since it's a perfect circle. But that doesn't mean they didn't use the gap in the fence. There are clawprints near the hole, the same you saw today in the forest! However, they point to the forest, not the mansion. Maybe that demon you saw a few hours ago came from the mansion. Let's just hope, he was alone... You must block this hole, or else the mansion will be just as save as staying outside. You and Jenny carry a big statue over and put it in front of the hole. You open the door and head outside. The door creaks as it closes with a thud. The fog seems a little less thick from outside and you see no threats about. Some light is filtering through the fog, but you don't know if it's the sun or some artificial light-source. You walk a long, the bat hanging at your side. The street is a damp dirt road with stone gutters on the sides. As you pass the shops along the way you try to stay calm, but the hair on your neck stands on end. A cat rushes past and you automatically swing at it, striking it square in the belly. It flies through the air and lands in the gutter on the other side of the street. Your fearful surprise knocks you on the ground as you swing the bat. You turn to look towards the cat, to see if it's still alive, and it is staring directly at you. You stare back. It arches it's back and hisses. It's fur is raven-black, it's eyes piercing green. Then it charges you and, scrambling to your feet, you run towards the diner. It's not far, less than a block away, but it seems so far as the hissing cat gets closer. You throw the bat at it to stall it, but it doesn't miss a beat and jumps over it. You barely make it to the diner in time, rush inside, and slam the door behind you, You sit down and lean your back against it.
"Jenny! Jenny!" you cry aloud. What was that demon-cat, you wonder. She walks in from the back, kitchen area of the diner. "Jenny, thank God you're here. A demon cat almost killed me! Are there many here?" you gasp.
"Yes, in fact, there are quite a few" she said, a little quietly. I'm sorry you almost died, because those cats could kill you, but I am glad it brought you back here. Now, how about it. Do you want a drink?"
"Oh, than you, let me see if I have any money," you reply.
"No, it's on the house. I'm not making money anyways."
"Okay then, sure. Thanks again."
"Don't thank me before you find you like it." Jenny turns on one foot and heads towards the counter, holding her abdomen with her right hand as she goes to make your drink. You see her wince as she reaches for a glass high up on a shelf.

You suddenly feel wide awake, adrenalin rushing through your veins, as you try to regain your balance.

You squint your eyes--as if that would help you see into the impenetrable darkness--and slowly take a step backwards, wondering what the hell kind of deviant would place a bed on the edge of a cliff. Just as you place your foot down behind you, a piercing cold grip takes hold of your front leg's ankle and begins pulling you down and toward the ledge. You scream as your bottom hits the ground, but all you hear is your own erratic heartbeat. No sight or sound. This unnerves you more than anything you've witnessed so far, even more so than the unseen, icy fingers wrapped around your angle.

Too afraid to lean in closer and use your hands, you decide to kick at whatever may be in front of you, pulling at your leg; but all you hit is air. You immediately regret that action, because you've been dragged forward several inches; you're feet are now dangling over the edge.

You frantically begin trying to force the cold hand off your ankle with the edges of your rubber soles; but just as you think it might be working, you are yanked even further towards the ledge. The backs of your knees are now comfortably bent over the cliff. You feel around for something to hold onto, but there are only sharp rocks and pebbles on the floor.

At this point, you have nothing to lose; you begin to frantically kick your legs, hoping whatever it is that has a hold of you will lose its grip. It seems to be working. You manage to flip over onto your stomach and try to use your arm strength to crawl away. That's when you felt two more hands--just as frosty but much bigger--on the backs of your thighs. There is a sudden and eerie pause in all action, which gives you a tiny bit of hope, just before you are dragged over the cliff.

A powerful falling sensation takes over, and you give into the inevitable and allow yourself to be taken by gravity. You close your eyes and wait for the fall to end--for your end to come, but a hypnic jerk stirs you awake.

info.brief_description: You are trapped in a nightmare, will you escape?
info.description:
You wake to find yourself in a strange town covered in a dense fog. Odd, scary sounds fill the air. You catch a glimpse of some kind of bizarre creature shuffling by, but you're not exactly sure what it is.

There aren't any definite rules, as Silent Hill is a town that is different for each person who visits it. Those who find themselves there find themselves in a waking nightmare. You can fight off zombie nurses, dogs and other strange creatures. If you've played the games or seen the movie, you will know what to expect!

What are you searching for? What guilty secret haunts you? How will you escape Silent Hill?
